Job Title: Analyst/Assistant Vice President, Credit Portfolio Management and Reporting
Job Description:
Do you want your voice heard and your actions to count?
Discover your opportunity with Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), the 7th largest financial group in the world. Across the globe, we’re 160,000 colleagues, striving to make a difference for every client, organization, and community we serve. We stand for our values, building long-term relationships, serving society, and fostering shared and sustainable growth for a better world.
With a vision to be the world’s most trusted financial group, it’s part of our culture to put people first, listen to new and diverse ideas and collaborate toward greater innovation, speed and agility. This means investing in talent, technologies, and tools that empower you to own your career.
Join MUFG, where being inspired is expected and making a meaningful impact is rewarded.
Job Responsibilities:
Prepare internal credit portfolio reports, regulatory reports / surveys as applicable
Responsible for assisting in the monitoring of the Branch’s credit portfolio and identifying potential credit exposures in order to mitigate credit risk.
Prepare and analyse provision figures under SGAAP/IFRS9 framework
Assist in formulating scenarios for credit stress test, conduct stress test and analyse the stress test results
Liaise with internal/external stakeholders on credit portfolio matters
Presentation of portfolio trends/reviews, stress test results and other credit-related topics to Management during monthly Credit Committee meetings and other internal Forums.
Participate in projects relating to the implementation/revision of regulatory or internal reporting
Support enquiry from business and other stakeholders in relation to credit regulatory reporting and portfolio management
Support internal and external audits within the department by preparing documentation as required
Maintain good working knowledge of industry trends, products, relevant laws and regulations.
Job Requirements:
Minimum 1 year of experience in corporate credit related reporting/management (Analyst)
Minimum 3 years of experience in corporate credit related reporting/management and Stress Test (AVP)
Knowledge in Banking products and credit risk
Familiarity with MAS IWST (credit), MAS credit-related reports/surveys and IFRS framework will be an advantage
Experience in using Microsoft skills (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
Good analytical skills to interpret large and complex data sets and ability to identify implications of data sets.
Committed and able to handle time-sensitive reports / projects
Good communication and presentation skills with ability to influence others using complex data or analysis to support line of reasoning.
Able to work in teams as well as standalone
Good interpersonal skills to deal effectively with others.
We regret to inform that only shortlisted applicants will be notified.
MUFG Bank Ltd & MUFG Securities Asia Limited (collectively referred to as “MUFG”) is an equal opportunity employer. REV - Revenue Management
Singapore
Cathay Pacific
Application Deadline
01 Apr 2024

Company Description

Let your passion fly! We’re proud to be one of the world’s leading airlines. Our reputation is built on a long track record of success, an ongoing commitment to our home Hong Kong, and on the delivery of customer service that’s straight from the heart. All of this is possible due to our talented people who share our passion for aviation and our commitment to being the best. Our global family can open up a world of opportunities for you. This means that your first role at Cathay Pacific won’t be your last. It could take you anywhere. Join us and discover just how far you can go!
Role Introduction

The Senior Data Insights Analyst is responsible to support the Business Insights &Analytics Manger in the analysis, implementation and performance management of the market or region for optimisation of Corporate, Agency and Digital sales programmes.
In this role, you will support the Business Insights & Analytics team’s end-to-end regional commercial strategy planning process, starting from goal setting, initiatives formulation to implementation and tracking, with the aim to drive revenue across different customer segments and distribution channels. You will use data analytical tools (both internal and external) to perform analysis and provide commercial teams (i.e. Local/Regional Marketing, Digital, Sales teams) with actionable insights that helps to identify revenue opportunities. You will also be responsible for measuring the success of all sales or go-to-market activities, as well as sharing all learnings with respective stakeholders for future improvements.

Key Responsibilities

Business Planning
Work closely with Head Office (Revenue Management, Sales & Distribution, Digital) and Regional Teams on end-to-end business planning process, from developing strategic commercial strategy, campaigns/initiatives planning to execution and performance tracking
Consolidate local market intelligence or any sales opportunities (e.g. MICE, special group movements) and share/discuss with Head Office with proposed plan to win deals with high success rates and incremental revenue
Develop targeted and customer-centric incentives action plans that are competitive in the local markets within assigned budget
Support local sales teams in tracking incentives performance, business development or up-/cross-selling activities so that CX remains as the preferred choice for the trade partners and for our customers
Observe market activities and brainstorm with local stakeholders to design customized products for targeted customer segments, and collaborate with Head Office for new product launch
Assist Regional Head of Business Insights & Analytics to formulate commercial budget plan
Be actively involved in formulating and ensuring the achievement of the offline market distribution strategy for the region (if applicable)
Devise strategy to improve value of incentives and NDC remunerations in the region

Analytics Champion
Act as the analytics champion for the region – i.e. well-versed with all in-house and external data analytical tools (i.e. DDS, QlikSense, PRISM)
Analyze data, develop reports, draw inferences and provide actionable insights to Regional Sales Teams, including new trends/customer purchase behaviors, new sales opportunities and areas of improvements
Own the performance tracking of all campaigns/ initiatives with clear and defined metrics; identify learning points and continue to improve so as to achieve the target
Drive adoption of all analytical tools and cultivate data-driven culture within the Regional and Outport teams
Conduct ad-hoc commercial studies and support Head Office-driven analytics projects when required

Pricing and Fare Filing
Provide local-specific insights in the formulation of pricing strategies with HO RMO
Monitor the effectiveness of the pricing strategies and initiate change discussions when needed
Responsible for year-round proactive campaign planning process – i.e. developing campaign proposals, benchmarking, market insights and campaign tracking
Review and analyze local market Corporate discount parameters, Global Specialty products (i.e. students/MICE/Seamen/Cruise)
Manage communications with local sales teams on fare changes, fare conditions revision, new products/campaigns launches and/or any government fares filing (if required)
Provide Corporates fare filing support (i.e. new or updated changes) for local Corporate sales teams
Assist with checking new live fares on GDS to ensure 100% accuracy and troubleshooting of any fare auto-pricing errors
Manage ad-hoc fare proposal and requests

E&A Responsibility
Emergency and Accident and Crisis Response responsibilities as required
Requirements

Qualifications and Requirements
University Degree (Preferably in related disciplines) with minimum 3+ years’ experience in data analysis in a regional team set up
Strong numeric and statistical analytical skills are essential
Able to present analysis clearly with findings and actionable insights
Demonstrated positive and innovative learning attitude, problem-solving skills and stakeholder management
Knowledge of airline/travel management systems including DDS, MIDT and PRISM is an advantage
Practical experience with any analytical tools (i.e. QlikSense, Tableau, QlikView) is an advantage
Travel/Airline industry experience preferred
Expert knowledge of MS Suite of tools
Benefits

Be part of the Cathay Pacific family and join a dynamic team culture working for one of the world’s Top 10 Global Airlines.
Make the most of your leave and take advantage of travel industry discounts including airfares, hotels, tours and car hire.
Fly high with career development opportunities to diversify your skills and experience within the Cathay Pacific family.

Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure best-practice A/B test experimentation implementation, and analyse results to provide insights

Communicate and present insights to key stakeholders and senior management
Develop business domain expertise within Marketplace

At least 5 years’ of working experience as a Data/Business/Product/Customer Analyst, Consultant, or other related fields is preferred
Expert knowledge in analytical tools such as SQL, Excel
Highly responsible and independent, with strong sense of ownership
Strong analytical, curious, business-oriented and written/oral communication skills
Demonstrates structural thinking, problem-solving, able to break down problems into actionable solution(s)
Demonstrate good data visualisation and experience using its tools (e.g. Tableau, Data Studio)
Keen learner, open to feedback and self-improvement
Experience and strong working knowledge of various aspects of Data Analyst is preferred

(Preferred) Experience with big data ecosystem (Hadoop, Spark, Hive)

Senior Pricing Analyst
Our culture believes in POWERING YOUR POTENTIAL . We provide global opportunities to develop your career, make your community a better place and work with today’s most innovative thinkers to solve the world’s toughest problems.
We believe in flexibility for you to explore your passions while making an impact through meaningful work within our inclusive workforce. That’s what #LifeAtCummins is all about.
We are looking for a talented Senior Pricing Analyst to join our team in Tuas South, Singapore . This role will be following Hybrid work model . Multiple location option is available (Singapore or Australia)
In this role, you will make an impact in the following ways:
Produces and secures the distribution of pricing information (electronic media and catalogs) and maintains a library of analytical programs. Implements pricing changes throughout the company and the customer base.
Maintains accurate pricing data in order management and rebates systems including account setup and data verification; tracks and monitors win/loss data such as requests for quotes.
Makes pricing recommendations on new product pricing and price changes; implements and reviews price adjustments; executes pricing strategy at a new product or market segment level.
Leads, manages, or participates in pricing improvement projects; develops outcome and pricing improvements.
Creates reports and analysis; presents results and conclusions to managers.
Provides direct and prompt assistance to customers regarding complex pricing issues through various media (phone, email, fax, letter).
Maintains confidential information and manages the use of this information appropriately.
Contributes to continuous improvement teams and implements new processes and programs.
Coaches and mentors less experienced Pricing Analysts.
Qualifications
To be successful in this role you will need the following:
Customer focus - Building strong customer relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions.
Ensures accountability - Holding self and others accountable to meet commitments.
Builds networks - Effectively building formal and informal relationship networks inside and outside the organization.
Collaborates - Building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives.
Communicates effectively - Developing and delivering multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences.
Manages ambiguity - Operating effectively, even when things are not certain, or the way forward is not clear.
Translating Relevant Market Data - Collects and categorizes customer voices and market information by leveraging appropriate research tools and techniques; analyses research findings to identify opportunities to deliver customer solutions.
Market Forecasting - Analyses and interprets market data from a variety of internal and external sources and modelling to formulate unbiased market projections specific to business segment.
Pricing Strategy - Develops prices by aligning and building consensus with key stakeholders across functions to achieve business targets.
Preferred Qualification:
College, university, or equivalent degree in Finance, Marketing, Strategy, Accounting, or a related subject required. This position may require licensing for compliance with export controls or sanctions regulations.
Intermediate level of relevant work experience required.
Intermediate in Excel and BI tools and good to have SAP knowledge.
Analytical background preferred.
Attention to details, good communication, collaborative and problem solver.
This role is not able to support on cross-border relocation, but this role can also be filled in AU (Sydney or Melbourne) based on candidate’s location.

Job Title: Regulatory Transaction Reporting Analyst – Quality Assurance
Job Description:
Singapore
Operations
Investment Bank
Job Reference #
290724BR
City
Singapore
Job Type
Full Time
Your role
Do you thrive when navigating complex environments? Are you always up for the next challenge? We're looking for someone like that to:
– Understand the APAC regulations to enhance and conduct quality assurance checks for the in scope APAC regulations and ensure that the RTR processes are being performed in accordance with the regulatory requirement.
– Identify non-compliant issues on completeness, timeliness and accuracy and improvement areas.
– Support the automation agenda in reviewing manual processes and controls, providing the requirements for automation, participating in User Acceptance Testing and supporting rollout of the change initiatives.
– Support Group Internal Audit and External Audit in their Transaction Reporting reviews
– Assist to prepare material for the various Transaction Reporting Governance forums from risk meetings, regular Steering Committees through to Board meetings

Your team
You will be joining the Regulatory Transaction Reporting (RTR) team within the APAC Investment Banking Operations division based in Singapore. The Regulatory Transaction Reporting (RTR) team supports the APAC region in ensuring TR regulation within the region is understood and adhered to. The team key responsibility is to ensure that we meet all APAC transaction reporting obligations, implementing proper governance, supervision, and change management across all APAC locations where there are transactional reporting obligations and ensuring quality assurance on post reporting and procedural controls.
Your expertise
You have:
– 1 to 3 years of relevant work experience in operational processes and controls.

Job Title: AVP, Risk Analyst for Debt Capital Markets (DCM) Business
Job Description:
Do you want your voice heard and your actions to count?
Discover your opportunity with Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), the 6th largest financial group in the world. Across the globe, we’re 160,000 colleagues, striving to make a difference for every client, organization, and community we serve. We stand for our values, building long-term relationships, serving society, and fostering shared and sustainable growth for a better world.
With a vision to be the world’s most trusted financial group, it’s part of our culture to put people first, listen to new and diverse ideas and collaborate toward greater innovation, speed and agility. This means investing in talent, technologies, and tools that empower you to own your career.
Join MUFG, where being inspired is expected and making a meaningful impact is rewarded.
Job responsibilities:
The AVP role within the market risk management department will be in charge of
Providing risk assessment to underwriting transactions by Asia Investment Banking Debt Capital Market (DCM) business. Review and challenge of DCM’s new and on-going transactions. Generation of reports to track and monitor the underwriting (UW) positions.
[Risk Assessment for DCM business (Marketable Credit Risk) – 90%]
Analyse and evaluate Debt Capital Markets team’s underwriting applications. This includes reviewing transaction material and the analysis submitted by the Business, checking the compliance of UW transactions with policy and underwriting guidelines
Preparing risk assessment commentaries on various risk categories such as Transaction Structure, Pricing and Liquidity Map in a quick and prompt turnaround manner
Coordinate and Participate in Underwriting Committee
Liaison point for various stakeholders – DCM team, International Credit Division (ICD), Head office Risk team, Internal Audit and senior management
Review and Challenge front line to enhance the overall risk framework from the second line of defence perspective
Prepare daily and periodic reports of Underwriting business transactions
Monitor and review the various thresholds and limits set for Notional, Underwriting Period, Loss limits for Underwriting business
Track and monitor the Early Warning Indicator (EWI) for Underwriting business
Organize regular/Ad-hoc meetings with other stakeholders in the bank to get updates on new developments on the pipeline transactions and any other underwriting related matters from Tokyo Head office and Europe/America regions
Support the team in maintaining and reviewing the documentation (e.g., Policy and Procedure) related to UW business from risk perspective
Support the line leader/team leader in market risk department as required
[Market risk– 10%]
Support Market risk department with Macro Market analysis, Control checks, Risk and PnL Monitoring, Risk analysis, Market data capture and support to other branches in the region
Job Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics or related fields
At least 3 years working experience in Market risk, Credit Risk or Investment Banking
Broad product knowledge and competence in the analysis and documentation of loan, bond, trade finance, structured transactions and traded products, including derivatives and securities financing transactions
Sound knowledge and experience in risk analysis and formulating recommendations/comments on credit proposals
CFA, CPA or FRM certification is desirable but not must
Good knowledge of Excel, Word and Powerpoint
Good initiative and inter-personal skills, ability to work efficiently in a team and independently.
Good communication skills (both verbal & writing)

Position: IT Business Analyst - Payment Systems Team
We are seeking an IT Business Analyst to join our Payment Systems Team. The successful candidate will play a key role in translating business operation requirements into functional system requirements, contributing to the ongoing evolution of the existing payments platform for the APAC region.
Direct Responsibilities:
Conduct requirements gathering sessions with business operations and other system interfaces.
Perform system functional analysis to facilitate the creation of functional requirements documents (FRS).
Develop operational workflows and use case diagrams.
Contribute to relevant sections of the Requirements Traceability Matrix (RTM).
Provide viable solutions to enhance operational efficiency, user experience, and business initiatives.
Review and sign off on artefacts and solutions produced by technical teams and vendors.
Provide support for System Integration Testing (SIT), User Acceptance Testing (UAT), regression testing, performance testing, and rehearsal testing to ensure successful implementation of solutions on schedule.
Contributing Responsibilities:
Collaborate with vendors and other application project teams for new payments platform development.
Contribute to end-to-end solutioning for new business products and offerings.
Share expertise through training and knowledge sharing sessions.
Support postproduction issues and provide necessary guidance to Business as usual (BAU) teams.
Competencies:
Technical:
10 years of IT experience in banking software development.
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Strong interpersonal and negotiation skills.
Ability to work in a dynamic and multicultural environment.
Capable of working independently or in a team to resolve issues and identify solutions promptly.
Extensive experience in Payments, Cash Management, and Transaction Banking projects.
Proficiency in various payment systems including TT, RTGS, ACH, Bulk Payments, Direct Debit, RealTime Payments, Cheques, Virtual Account, Liquidity Management, and Operations BAU processing across the APAC region.
Solid domain knowledge in Corporate Banking, Trade, and Wealth Management.
Sound functional analysis and project management skills.
Handson experience with Payment Operations processing, data interface mapping, and troubleshooting.
Familiarity with Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and/or Agile Scrum methodologies.
Good knowledge of CBPR, ISO20022 payment standard, and SWIFT messages.
Understanding of straight through processing (STP) and operational efficiency.
Familiarity with core banking, foreign exchange transactions, transaction reporting, payments filtering and AML, reconciliation and settlement, cash flow management, and financial regulatory reporting.
Knowledge of payment transformation lifecycle and implementation methodology.
Behavioral:
Strong presentation and documentation skills.
Ability to work effectively under pressure and meet tight deadlines.
Proactive problem-solving approach.
Capacity for collaboration and teamwork.
Adaptability to changing requirements and priorities.

Minimum 8 years of experience working in Banking IT Organization as part of a Payments Cash Management group in the role of Lead SME Lead Domain Architect
Must have experiences in driving complex engagements covering transformation roadmap TOM Solution Design IT delivery
Should have multi country implementation exposure of Payments solutions at regional global banks
Strong understanding of Cards and Payments industry global trends regulatory and compliance initiatives
Ability to drive engagements at CxO level as well as with delivery execution teams
Strong problem solving skills with ability to operate in constantly changing landscape with strict timelines and outcomes Lead engagements independently covering internal aspects as well as client requirements
Strong experience of Payments Interface data mapping and solution design
Strong Exposer to Payments Cash Management technology and end to end lifecycle across ACH RTGS Real Time Payments Open Banking Clearing Settlement Systems e.g. RTGS ACH RTP Cross Border payments with exposure to SWIFT ISO 20022
Experience of APAC payments scheme implementation one or many of the markets SG VN TH ID AU HK JP CN etc.

Hands on experience with one or more products like Finastra GPP FIS Clear2Pay OPF Dovetail ACI MTS TCSBancs etc.
Experienced in incubating and grooming teams in COE format Proven track record and experience in managing complex payments transformation projects
Strong Business Analyst experience and working in Agile model Highly developed conceptual and analytical skills Highly enthusiastic energetic and has a self starting capability

We are looking for a techincal business analyst who are passionate about delivering high quality IT applications and solutions. You will be part of the team that helps to improve and transform the processes in the banking and finance industry.
You will have opportunities to learn new skill set and acquire valuable domain knowledge as you work on the solutions that meet multifaceted technical and business requirements.

Roles and Responsibilities
Bridge the gap between business needs and technical solutions: Act as a liaison between various business stakeholders and the development team to ensure that business requirements are clearly understood and translated into technical solutions.
Collaborate with both business and technical teams to align objectives, prioritize tasks, and address any discrepancies or challenges that may arise during the development process.
Translate requirements into technical specs and actionable tasks for our development team located in Singapore and China: Take ownership of translating business requirements into detailed technical specifications, ensuring clarity and feasibility for the development team.
Break down complex requirements into manageable tasks and user stories, facilitating effective communication and task management within the distributed development team.
Gather requirements and document business requirements: Conduct thorough requirements gathering sessions with stakeholders to identify and prioritize business needs, objectives, and constraints.
Document business requirements accurately, ensuring completeness, clarity, and traceability throughout the project lifecycle.
Develop detailed user stories and acceptance criteria: Create comprehensive user stories that capture end-user perspectives, functional requirements, and acceptance criteria.
Define clear acceptance criteria to ensure that deliverables meet stakeholder expectations and quality standards.
Work closely with development teams to ensure timely delivery of solutions: Collaborate closely with development teams to provide guidance, clarification, and support throughout the development process.
Monitor project progress, identify potential bottlenecks, and proactively address any issues that may impact the timely delivery of solutions.
Conduct thorough testing of implemented solutions that meet business requirements: Plan and execute rigorous testing procedures to validate that implemented solutions fulfill specified business requirements and functional specifications.
Identify and report any defects or deviations from requirements, working with the development team to resolve issues promptly.
Provide support and guidance to stakeholders throughout the development lifecycle: Serve as a primary point of contact for stakeholders, offering support, guidance, and regular updates on project status, milestones, and deliverables.
Address stakeholder queries, concerns, and feedback in a timely and professional manner, ensuring a high level of satisfaction and engagement throughout the development lifecycle.
Identify and communicate risks, issues, and dependencies related to project delivery: Proactively identify potential risks, issues, and dependencies that may impact project delivery, and communicate them effectively to stakeholders and project teams.
Collaborate with relevant stakeholders to develop mitigation strategies, contingency plans, and resolutions for addressing identified risks and issues.

Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree: A bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or Business Administration.
Experience in the Banking Domain will be an advantage: Previous experience or exposure to the banking or financial services industry, including knowledge of banking products, processes, and regulatory requirements.
Experience in Agile methodologies and knowledgeable in software development Lifecycle and software testing: Hands-on experience with Agile methodologies (e.g., Scrum, Kanban) and a strong understanding of the software development lifecycle (SDLC) and software testing practices.
Familiarity with database SQL queries: Proficiency in writing and executing SQL queries to retrieve, manipulate, and analyze data from relational databases.
Familiarity with JIRA and Confluence: Experience using JIRA for project management and issue tracking, as well as Confluence for collaboration and documentation.
Experience and knowledge in OCR and workflow will be advantageous: Additional experience or expertise in Optical Character Recognition (OCR) technology and workflow automation processes would be beneficial for certain project requirements and initiatives.

Financial Markets Business Analyst, focusing on the Market Risk Stress Testing platform upkeep, enhancements, and Upgrades
The role sits in the Customer’s Financial Markets Trade Management team focusing on the build out of the in-house strategic cross asset risk platform is the bank’s strategic platform for trade processing, valuation and market. It consists in designing and delivering solutions to the users of this platform with an initial focus onboarding new products, driving enhancement solutions, planning project timelines and working with multiple stakeholders such as users and developers to achieve desired outcome.
As the main focus of the role is on the Trade Data Store, experience in trade booking, lifecycling and how a trade prices using static or market data is preferable. This would also require basic understanding of the financial products booked in the trades, such as FX, IR Swaps, Loans/Deposits, etc
The candidate should also have experience in MUREX trade booking, lifecycle events and cash settlement logic and processing. He/She would need to be able to explain the trade economics of the financial products, explain the Present Value of the trade and cashflow. He/She will also need to participate in trade migration verification activities, where the ability to design a solution for reconciliation of trade details and settled cash would be needed.
Business Analyst in Financial Markets Technology focused on Market Risk Stress Testing
Support User queries and production issues. Manage Platform analytics upgrade for Stress Testing.

Perform Solutioning for User requirements involving Quants and Data teams
Manage Delivery working with FM Tech Development Teams and QA Team

This role sits withing the FM Trade data services team which involves extending the Customers Trade Lake which is a core component of the platform, to build a future-proof trade store solution meeting on-going regulatory projects requirements, as well as enabling the strategic aim of reducing point to point connections and reliance on fragmented legacy systems, and supporting advanced Analytics on FM Trade data.

Coty is a world leader in beauty and home to an illustrious roster of cosmetic, skincare and fragrance brands. And our company has a mission: to challenge the definition of beauty, to encourage authenticity and celebrate diversity. Because to us at Coty, beauty isn’t about conforming to somebody else’s ideal. It’s about inclusion and liberating everyone to shine in their unique way.

THE ROLE
Division: Asia Business Intelligence
Job Title: Business Intelligence Intern (Asia)

About the Role
If you have business acumen and an affinity for numbers/data, this is an opportunity to you to experience firsthand what it is like to govern datasets and flows that essentially form the basis of business decisions within Coty Asia Pacific, which covers more than 20 countries including, Japan, Korea, Australia, SE Asia, and India. You will manage different kinds of data from market share to Google Trends to forecasting and sales,
and from different angles be it brand/category focus or retailer/channel focus. You will obtain in-depth hands-on experience on Power BI, which is a common tool across companies and skills would be easily transferable. Lastly, by the end of the internship, you will have a better understanding of your strengths and direction – be it as a business analyst, a citizen developer, or mix of both.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Liaise with key stakeholders (both internal and external) on data availability
Manage dashboards and data models in Power BI and Power Query
Consolidate structured data to fit into existing models
Data analysis and visualisation for business reporting

WHAT YOU’LL BRING

ESSENTIAL:
Undergraduates who can commit for at least 6 months (Jul to Dec 2024) for a full-time internship.
Strong affinity with numbers and data
Skilled in the use of MS Office tools including Outlook (or related email tool), Excel, and PowerPoint.
Self-motivated and self-starter, with a strong work ethic and a sense of confidentiality.
Possesses cross-cultural awareness and high emotional intelligence.
Articulate, with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Good balance of a professional attitude while having fun.
Strong interest in consumer goods or beauty products.
Strong desire to learn along with a strong sense of ownership.
Persuasive, resilient and flexible, able to easily adapt to new challenges.
Passionate, enthusiastic, and driven to regularly follow-up with loose ends.
Able to thrive despite challenges while adopting a positive attitude under pressure.

LEARNING OUTCOMES
Understand how a consumer goods company operates, especially marketing, sales, and finance.
Able to create actionable models and reports for business users.

Overview
FGE is an international energy consultancy specializing in world-class independent research and analysis of the energy markets. We are a team of experienced professionals with a wide range of international clients such as energy companies, financial institutions, trading houses, utilities, and governments. We offer the full suite of research and consulting services including reports and presentations, data and analytics solutions, and bespoke consulting engagements.

What awaits you
This current opportunity is to join FGE’s Gas/LNG team in Singapore. We are a team that provides leading-edge market analysis to our clients with a focus on commercial insight. As the world embarks on its decarbonization journey, it is paramount to understand energy systems in a holistic context. We apply a variety of modelling techniques and incorporate both quantitative and qualitative information to underpin our forward-looking view.
The entrepreneurial spirit of the Gas/LNG team allows for a dynamic working environment that enables the company to adapt and develop its products in line with changes within the industry. This dynamism also allows the company to provide unrivalled organic growth opportunities to candidates with a proven ability to develop and expand the business.
Team members are exposed to a wide variety of on-the-job training opportunities based on their progression and as part of FGE’s ongoing activities. Our team leverages members’ strengths and interests to keep individuals engaged while producing relevant research for our clients. There is ample room for further career development, to anchor and lead key elements of research coverage.


The Role and Responsibilities
The ideal candidate would be a member of the Gas/LNG team to ensure that our views and published research are timely, comprehensive, coherent, and insightful. The key deliverables include:
Formulate timely and forward-looking views of key market developments and their impact on natural gas and LNG markets.
Generate commercially relevant market insights and deliver them to clients via written reports and presentations.
Develop and maintain supply and demand models to forecast gas and power balances in downstream markets.
Source for and incorporate a variety of quantitative and qualitative data to ensure the timeliness and accuracy of FGE’s analysis.
Support bespoke consulting engagements as well as the development of FGE’s research products and databases.
Collaborate with FGE’s international offices and various experts to deliver a consistent and coherent view of the energy markets.
Engage with clients to understand different perspectives and ensure that FGE’s research is relevant and insightful.
Act as the subject matter expert on specific markets or segments of value chain and communicate key findings to the team.


Applicant Requirements
We are looking for highly motivated individuals who are passionate about the energy sector and the energy transition. The ideal candidate will have experience in natural gas, LNG, or power markets. Experience in oil or commodity market analysis or trading analytics is also welcomed. The key requirements and qualifications include:
Able to do independent research and work with a project team.
Pro-active in suggesting research ideas and improving existing analytical tools.
Able to distil key findings into clear visualizations and concise narratives.
Excellent report writing and presentation skills.
Able to multi-task and perform in a deadline-driven environment.
Comfortable working with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
Candidates must be legally entitled to work in Singapore.
0 to 5 years of working experience. Having a background in energy or commodity market research and analysis will be advantageous.
Fluency in English is essential. Fluency in Mandarin or other Asian languages is a plus.
Experience with data analytics, visualization, and automation tools is a plus (e.g., Power Query, Power BI, etc.).
Opportunistic hires will be placed in appropriate positions according to their experience and skill sets.


How Do I Apply for This Position?
If you are interested in applying for this position, and you meet the above requirements, please submit your application through our Online Application Form . Unfortunately, due to the high number of applications we receive, we are only able to contact applicants who have been selected for interview. Please note, we are only able to process applications that include a CV. Those without will not be processed.

Health Analytics Manager
Join our team and help us transform the health industry with data-driven solutions.
Job Summary
As a health analytics manager, you will support the objectives of health strategy, develop a roadmap and use cases that align with it, and lead the delivery of health analytics products. You will work closely with data science and data engineering teams to leverage data and insights to improve health outcomes and customer experience. You will also collaborate with business stakeholders and external partners to understand their needs and provide actionable recommendations.
Key Responsibilities
Define and execute the health analytics strategy and roadmap, ensuring alignment with Prudential's health vision and goals.
Manage the end-to-end delivery of health analytics products, from ideation to deployment, ensuring quality, timeliness, and scalability.
Work with data science and data engineering teams to design, develop, and test data models, algorithms, and pipelines that support health analytics use cases.
Work with business stakeholders and external partners to understand their requirements, challenges, and opportunities, and provide data-driven solutions and insights.
Communicate and present health analytics findings and recommendations to senior management and relevant audiences, using clear and compelling visualizations and narratives.
Stay abreast of the latest trends, technologies, and best practices in health analytics, and identify opportunities for innovation and improvement.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree or higher in data analytics, data science, statistics, mathematics, computer science, or related field.
At least 8-10 years of experience in data analytics, data science, or related role in the insurance or health industry.
Familiarity with end-to-end analytics solutions build and servicing, code writing, and code testing best practices is essential.
Experience in translating business problems into data and analytics solutions and influencing senior stakeholders and business partners in their adoption.
Communication and presentation abilities to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Proficiency in programming languages and tools (e.g. Python, SQL, Spark)
Understanding of cloud-based data platform and analytics technologies (e.g., Azure, Databricks, MLflow)
Ability to work independently and in a team, and to handle multiple tasks and deadlines.
Passionate about improving health outcomes and customer experience through data and analytics.

At Kpler, we simplify global trade information and provide valuable insights. Founded in 2014, our goal is to help over 10,000 organisations by offering the best intelligence on commodities, energy, and maritime through a single platform.

Working at Kpler means you'll be a key player in turning complex data into strategic resources for our clients. Your role involves creating data-driven stories that empower clients in their industries.

Your expertise helps Kpler navigate markets successfully. Your journey starts here, where innovation meets impact. Join our team of 500+ talented people from 35+ countries worldwide.

Kpler is looking for an experienced Analyst in Singapore to help support and further develop our industry-leading LNG products. Our constantly evolving offering spans a wide range of market data including cargo-tracking, inventories, and freight.
Your mission is to:
Monitor the Kpler LNG platform and constantly ensure the highest level of accuracy and timeliness of our data. This will involve daily checking, structuring, and analysis of cargo-level data.
Maintain and expand a comprehensive dataset relating to the LNG market.

Work closely with the global sales teams to demonstrate the value of Kpler’s solutions to the industry.
Follow the main events occurring in the LNG market, track specific trends impacting global trade flows, and build a network of contacts in the industry.
Regularly interact with prospective/existing clients to help them extract as much value from our products as possible.

Have an undergraduate degree in Economics, Finance, International Trade or Engineering related fields.
Have at least 3 years of experience as an Analyst (or a similar role) covering the LNG market (experience working within the broader commodities industry will also be considered).
Are a highly motivated individual, a self-starter who will be passionate about owning responsibilities upholding the trusted accuracy and agility of the Kpler data.
Are skilled at carrying out complex analysis across multiple datasets using appropriate tools.
Have advanced Excel skills, and a good understanding of SQL and other languages such as Python or VBA.
Demonstrate strong capabilities in logical thinking with attention to detail.
Have experience working with large, disparate and/or unstructured data
Possess excellent analytical ability, at ease with working with databases and able to highlight trends and use complex data to support decisions.
Are an effective team player, quick learner and able to cope with short deadlines across different simultaneous projects with minimal supervision.
Have great communication and interpersonal skills, able to effectively discuss various technical and business topics with internal and external stakeholders.

Summer Internship 2024 - Data Analyst & BI Intern
Company
Munich Re
Location
Singapore , Singapore
Munich Re Group is one of the world’s leading providers of reinsurance. As pioneers in risk assessment, we drive the digital transformation of the global insurance landscape, expanding products and services as new forms of risk emerge. From space rocket launches to cyber-attacks, from high-net worth individuals to pandemics, we take care of risks so our clients can take care of their businesses.

Join us this Summer for our Structured Internship Program from May to August 2024. In addition to gaining valuable work experience alongside industry experts, you will also benefit from ongoing engagement, career development and networking activities.

You will be part of Munich Re’s Regional AI/Analytics Team (RAC) in Singapore, and will provide valuable support to the data analytics team. The RAC supports Munich Re’s Asia-Pacific (including China and Australia), Middle East and Africa Life and Health business region. As such you will work in an agile and innovative area, gaining exposure to a wide variety of business problems and solving them with AI and Data, other teams of Munich Re, clients and geographies.

Your Role
Work with complex insurance data sets from across the value chain such as sales, underwriting, claims and risk
Conduct multivariate analytics via BI tools/ Coding in Python & R and working with cloud resources to generate business insights and dashboard/reports
Support the research and development of new machine / deep learning use cases
Support an Agile project team consisting of Business Experts, Actuaries, Data Scientists, BI experts and Data Engineers within the regional analytics team.
Work with various stakeholders across the whole APAC region, including Middle East, Japan and Africa.
Research industry best practices and coming up with practical solutions to help develop and/or improve business.
Support ongoing projects and R & D initiatives which span across the entire insurance value chain
Help prepare high quality demos on various platforms to demonstrate analytical capabilities

Your Profile
Pursuing a Master’s degree in data science / artificial intelligence, data analytics, statistics, computer science, information technology, or a comparable discipline
Knowledge and experience creating reports / dashboarding
Hands-on experience on BI tools such as Power BI or Tableau or QlikView
Strong theoretical knowledge of AI, ML and DL methods
Strong MS Excel knowledge (can write advanced macros)
Hands-on coding experience with at least one programming language such as Python/ R
Familiarity with tools such as Dash, RShiny or Streamlit is a plus
Knowledge of Azure DevOps is a plus
Capacity for innovation, forward-looking, meeting realistic timelines, and enjoy working in a team
Able to effectively explain analysis, both verbally and in writing, and translate analysis into a clear business plan

At Munich Re, we embrace, and value, the interaction of diverse backgrounds, experience, perspectives and thought. This interaction is the foundation of our open culture, spirit of partnership, of how our teams are built and cultivated, and of how we are supported and developed. And at the centre of this interaction is each of us.
Apply now!

Job Title: Data Compliance and Access Operations Senior Analyst
Job Description:
Responsibilities
About TikTok
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.
Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.
To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.
At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.
Join us.

The Global Security Organization provides industry leading security and privacy services to ByteDance globally. Our organization uses four principles that guide our strategic and tactical operations. First, we champion trust and transparency, leading the charge in organizational transparency and execution of security and privacy capabilities that drive customer trust. Second, we are a business catalyst and enabler, embodying the DNA of technical innovation. Third, we drive risk informed and empowered decision making, giving our business leaders the information needed to make key decisions. Finally, we proactively identify and reduce risk while enabling innovative product development – to consistently build sustainable world-class security capabilities.

TikTok is seeking a Senior Analyst for Access Approval Operations to be part of the Data Protection team and will be responsible for overseeing operations and management of data access and data transfer requests to ensure they are in compliance with relevant company policy, geographical regulation, contractual commitments, and confidentiality requirements. This role reports directly to the Access Management and Compliance Lead within the Global Security Organization.
The candidate must be skilled in conducting technical analysis of access policies, rules, and permissions as well as evaluating appropriateness of roles and transactions. The candidate must also have the ability to communicate well, motivate and lead cross-functional teams independently, participate in coordinating response and defensive actions as it relates to identity and access assurance, and disseminate security information as appropriate in support of TikTok's critical business, go to market, and operational infrastructure needs. The candidate will develop, select, and motivate highly effective employees to execute TikTok's business model.

Responsibilities
Design and implement data access requirements and controls as necessitated by business needs and regulations
Design the organization's role-based access control scheme and rationalize existing groups
Design and implement the access review process, ensuring that access is reviewed regularly, both for appropriateness of access as well as privilege levels for all users
Understand the access management policies and procedures and the implications on TikTok's business model
Build and review technical and functional requirements for in-house or external technologies to support access management and assurance needs
Interact with users to define access standards and/or necessary modifications to new or existing access policies or roles in support of data security standards
Evaluate access request business justifications to align with the principle of least privilege and defined policies for access approvals
Understand defined data categories and data transfer rules, and the implications on TikTok's regional regulatory obligations
Evaluate business requests for data transfer based on interoperable needs, to align with regional legal and regulatory requirement
Serve as access management liaison and interact with cross-business line applicants to communicate access standards and/or gather required information
Design, implement and maintain new review procedures and continually update internal documentation involving new regulatory, company, and reporting requirements
Establish, track and report operational metrics to senior leadership
Address emergency access related matters reported within on-calls
Coordinate escalations and address any blockers to appropriate cross-business line stakeholders
Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelors’ Degree or industry equivalent work experience
2-4 years experience working in cybersecurity or information security
Must have a strong understanding of:
Data classification and concepts of data minimisation
Access management tools, processes, and procedures. User access administration, role and policy-based access controls, including identity management, provisioning and de-provisioning access, Privileged access management (PAM) tools, Access reviews for appropriateness and authorization. Interpretation of numeric data and statistical principles and industry standard frameworks & IAM tools
Familiarity with regulatory data privacy landscape (e.g., GDPR, CCPA)
Must have ability to design and queries, database access management across multiple types (e.g., MySQL, Redis, MongoDB)
Preferred Qualifications
Ability to operate in fast-paced environments and pivoting priorities while demonstrating the ability to quickly adapt in the face of constantly evolving cybersecurity challenges or non-standard situations
Must possess a high degree of integrity, be trustworthy, and have the ability to lead and inspire change
Must possess the ability to perform under pressure, within time/budget constraints to solve problems, adjust quickly to shifting priorities, and make decisions with limited information
Be flexible in working hours to support a shift work schedule (morning, day, evening)
Ability to support escalations reported in on-call rotations to ensure timely incident response
Ability to communicate technical concepts to a broad range of technical and non-technical staff
Ability to communicate and work closely with colleagues in different time zones
Demonstrate teamwork and collaboration skills, in particular in leading or contributing to global and multi-functional teams
Strong analytical/problem-solving skills and cross-functional expertise across multiple IT operational and security disciplines
TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Strong financial background and knowledge
Excellent communication skills and tactical planning skills

We're an international bank, nimble enough to act, big enough for impact. For more than 160 years, we've worked to make a positive difference for our clients, communities, and each other. We question the status quo, love a challenge and enjoy finding new opportunities to grow and do better than before. Job Title: Customer Excellence Data Analytics & Reporting Lead
Job Description:
Job Purpose and Impact

The role of Commercial Excellence Data Analytics and Reporting Lead will build, improve, and execute the customers insights capability for CASC APAC. This role will partner with our commercial leaders and teams to identify, build, analyze, and operationalize the most valuable customer insights for the business group through utilization of existing and future platforms, sources, and technologies. In this role, you will present findings and recommendations, outline the value, and achieve successful business outcomes, solidify data ownership, and mature data consumption.

The key objectives of the role are:
Grow customer insights capability across CASC APAC by improving data integrity and transforming customer transaction data into insights for sales team performance and margin growth opportunities.

Play an integral role in building of additional customer data driven metrics and assisting in the simplification of our business processes and tools used by sales team.

Devise/ execute a strategy to enhance the use of data analytics (descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive) across commercial teams. Contribute to define the regional priorities for Commercial excellence in the region, aligned with global initiatives.

Enable the movement of sales organization away from multiple systems by owning customer/transaction data and its transition into a CRM tool in the longer term. Increase adoption of tools like CRM to capture business critical data that will aid in decision making.

Increase data transparency across teams by creating new and enhancing existing data products like Customer 360, customer profitability. Key Accountabilities

Insight Identification: Partner with leaders to identify most critical customer insights needed to (1) measure success against strategy, (2) assess improvements to customer satisfaction and experiences, (3) inform go to market strategies and (4) predict and identify new and future customer opportunities.

Insights Analysis: Apply effective analysis and synthesis from various internal and external sources to generate relevant, strategically aligned insights that create value for the commercial organization.

Process Optimization: Build and optimize process and approach to customer data gathering and insight generation, including identification and sunsetting of current practices not adding value. Lead the architecture of reporting / analytical / metrics, including providing guidance on adequate use of reporting tools and avoid unnecessary proliferation of reports.

Stakeholder engagement : Work closely with and be the managing interface to our origination and sales teams, data and analytics team, FPA teams and commercial excellence COE around customer insights. Act as a key point of contact from Business standpoint within the region to facilitate the aspects of Data & Analytics strategy, Data Ownership, Data Priorities, Data Quality and Data product adoption, including ownership of data governance. Champion the Data and Analytics Strategy Road map, leading the change management to increase the data maturity of , region, which also includes intense communication & stakeholder management Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications

Business background with strong data & analytics, process and organizational skill set

Ability to analyze complex data sets and identify key customer insights and trends.

Knowledge and experience with various data platforms, including Salesforce, MarketLink, Lynx, Tableau and PowerBI

Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent experience

Minimum of six years of related work experience
Preferred Qualifications

Business minded with commercial knowledge in commodity preferred.

Success in building customer insights “system” from scratch, with strong process orientation

Ability to distill and communicate complex information in an easy to understand and persuasive manner to stakeholders, including senior leaders.

He or she shall have basic training on IT programming and graduted from IT related with bachelor degree and above

He or she shall be fluent in Mandrain and able to communicate with oversea colleagues

He or she shall have exposure to e-Commerce, especially have basic knowledge on furniture manufacturing

This is a 12 months contract assinged to our clients

Job Description


As a Multimedia Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in analyzing and interpreting visual data from various sources, including live streaming video, surveillance footage, and recorded media. Your insights will contribute to informed decision-making, process improvement, and overall organizational success.

What You'll Do:
1) Data Analysis
Analyze video, image, and audio content to extract meaningful information.
Identify patterns, anomalies, and relevant features within multimedia data.
2) Vector Database Management
Work with **Vector Databases** to store and retrieve high-dimensional data vectors.
Understand the intricacies of vector representations and their applications.
Leverage vector embeddings for efficient search and analytics.
3) Neo4j Graph Database Integration
Collaborate with database engineers to integrate multimedia data into **Neo4j Graph Databases.
Design and implement graph data models to represent relationships between multimedia entities.
Utilize Cypher query language for graph-based data retrieval.
4) Semantic Search and Recommendations
Develop search algorithms that consider semantic relevance rather than exact matches.
Create recommendation systems based on multimedia content similarity.
5) Data Quality Assurance
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and completeness within both vector and graph databases.
Implement data validation and cleansing processes.

Who You Are:
The ideal candidate would be:

Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., computer science, data science, multimedia analytics).
Proven experience in analyzing multimedia data (videos, images, audio).
Familiarity with Vector Databases
Exposure to machine learning models for feature extraction-generation.
Self-motivated and able to work well in a fast-paced environment.
Great communication and coordination skills
Excellent analytical thinking and problem-solving skills

Are you ready to unleash your potential?

At Deloitte, our purpose is to make an impact that matters for our clients, our people, and the communities we serve.

We believe we have a responsibility to be a force for good and WorldImpact is our portfolio of initiatives focused on making a tangible impact on society’s biggest challenges and creating a better future. We strive to advise clients on how to deliver purpose-led growth and embed more equitable, inclusive as well as sustainable business practices.

Hence, we seek talented individuals driven to excel and innovate, working together to achieve our shared goals.

We are committed to creating positive work experiences that foster a culture of respect and inclusion, where diverse perspectives are celebrated, and everyone is recognized for their contributions.

Work you’ll do:

You will be part of our structured Deloitte Consulting SEA Analyst Program and be given a personal coach, the opportunity to undergo a 1-month intensive bootcamp training aimed at equipping you with the skillsets necessary to excel, and opportunities to gain regional exposure by travelling across SEA as part of project assignments, and other professional development opportunities.


This program will allow you to develop core consulting skills and business acumen whilst gaining access to a wide scope of training and development activities. In addition, you will have an opportunity to work with like-minded people and gain exposure to a variety of projects within the chosen business area. You will be at the center of it all, performing research, data analysis and modelling to tackle complex business problems. In addition, you will contribute directly to the development of proposals, presentations, and publications.


Within our consulting practice, positions are available for the following portfolio offerings:
Strategy, Analytics & M&A
Customer & Marketing
Core Business Operations
Human Capital
Enterprise Technology & Performance

Your role as a leader:

At Deloitte, we believe in the importance of empowering our people to be leaders at all levels. We connect our purpose and shared values to identify issues as well as to make an impact that matters to our clients, people and the communities. Additionally, Analysts across our Firm are expected to:

Demonstrate a strong commitment to personal learning and development.
Understand how our daily work contributes to the priorities of the team and business.
Understand the set expectations and demonstrate accountability in keeping personal performance on track.
Actively focus on developing effective communications and relationship-building skills with stakeholders, clients and team.
Demonstrate an appreciation for working with others.
Understand what is fundamental to Deloitte’s success as a business.
Demonstrate integrity and an awareness of strengths, differences, and personal impact.
Develop their understanding of Deloitte and offer a fresh perspective.

Available to commence work in July 2024
Strong academic performance in your bachelor, master, or MBA degree
Recent graduate with no more than 2 years of working experience
Exceptional problem-solving ability. Logical reasoning, creative thinking, comfort with numbers, and the ability to untangle complex issues
Strong passion for consulting, ability to adapt and cope in a fast pace, challenging work hours and environment
Fluent in verbal and written English
Willingness to work outside of office base and most of all…
A sense of humour!

Job Title: Senior Business Analyst, Regional Operations (Return and Refund)
Job Description:
Apply Now
DepartmentOperations
LevelExperienced (Individual Contributor)
LocationSingapore
The Operation teams at Shopee covers the operational end-to-end process, from when the buyer searches for a product listed on the Shopee platform, to the moment the buyer receives the products. The team analyses and monitors operational KPIs across the region and conducts root cause analysis when operation performance fluctuates. The Operations team comprises Customer Service, Payment, Listings, Warehouse, Logistics, Seller Operations and Fraud.
Job Description:
Lead key projects related to returns and refunds process/product improvement and define key metrics to measure project success
Draw insights from data sets and apply data-driven methods to identify user pain points related to returns and refund journey on Shopee
Identify and design initiatives to solve operational issues related to returns and refunds
Create project plan and align timelines and dependencies with different stakeholders
Size the impact of the identified initiatives to help with prioritisation of the features
Collaborate with local operations and product teams to refine proposed solutions and implement initiatives to improve user experience and optimise cost
Collaborate with product stakeholders to implement system driven initiatives
Monitor performance of initiatives post launch and identify improvement opportunities or gaps
Requirements:
A Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Business Analytics, Computer Science or any relevant degree, with at least 3 years of relevant work experience
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with proficiency in Python and SQL for data analysis and reporting
Passionate about identifying user pain points, process bottlenecks, or inefficiencies and designing solutions to resolve them
Strong desire to work on and take ownership of product-related projects to drive platform improvements and enhance end-user experience
Ability to coordinate tasks across various stakeholders, manage project progress and achieve goals in a timely manner
Ability to thrive in a dynamic and collaborative environment

The successful incumbent will be responsible for supporting the company’s strategy by strengthening the compliance ecosystem to drive global consistency by leveraging technical expertise to collecting & interpreting process data, proposing & monitoring improvements to ensure process compliance & consistency. In addition, besides championing & implementing digitalization the incumbent will support & execute process improvement initiatives.

Requirements
Degree with min 2 years in audit or compliance.
Strong communication skills, analytical and team player

6 months renewable contract
5 days work week / central location

Interested candidates may forward your resume to vas@hrfactors.com.sg

Design and execute a project plan to address and prioritise business reporting needs.

Working with internal stakeholders such as estimating and project teams to identify and link key business cost drivers to market forecasts, predicting business impacts and informing commercial strategies.

Developing and improving quarterly business report to inform global leadership teams of key business trends/ impacts across all reported metrics & reports.

Track record of managing projects from concept design to completion.
A degree in Analytics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, Information Technology, Data Sciences, Math or related fields is desired.

Job Description
Spearhead the department’s internal communication and engagement plan - assist in the planning, execution, and/or coordination of meetings, forums, and/or internal events. Responsible for regular and ad hoc senior management reporting and presentations.
Monitor and report on key performance indicators (KPIs) to track business and operational performance and identify areas for improvement.
