An exciting opportunity is waiting for you in the newly set up Centre of Excellence (COE) Marketing Experimentation & Personalization team in Changi Airport Group. Our team supports the various marketing units in the area of MarTech and MarOps with the aim to drive more data driven and personalized marketing campaigns. You will be responsible for the following areas:

Data Insights: Analyzes data from various sources (eg spend data, customer profile and web/app browsing behavior) to produce actionable insights to support or devise marketing strategies.
Performance Analysis: Analyze the performance of marketing campaigns and experiments by measuring metrics like open rate, conversion rates, click-through rates and return on investment (ROI). Track and regular reporting on how the campaign is performing and provide areas of improvement based on data analysis.
A/B Testing: Able to design and oversee A/B tests, which include giving advice on the statistical sampling and methodology for each test.
Customer Segmentation: Assist marketers in their customer segmentation strategies, and tailor campaigns to specific audience segments to drive incremental spend. Work with MarTech team to review and manage the attributes in Customer Data Platform.
ROI: Propose and measure the payback for MarTech investments, taking into considerations of all the incremental value captured from using the tools.
Adobe Analytics: Utilize Adobe Analytics to track, measure, and analyze key performance metrics for Changi Airport key digital channels, including traffic behavior and campaign performance.
Dashboard: Create data dashboards to track and monitor performance of marketing campaign strategies and extract actionable insights to ensure revenue growth.


Requirements
Degree in Statistics / Data Analytics or a related field
At least 5-6 years of relevant working experience
Strong technical skills in SQL and/or Python and high proficiency in Microsoft Excel
Experience in using Adobe Analytics, Business Intelligence Tool (eg Tableau / Microstrategy) and Customer Data Platform
Familiarity with A/B testing methodologies and the ability to analyze the results from the marketing experiments
Proficient in data analysis and ability to draw insights from data.
Strong communication skills (verbal and written/visual) to create and deliver compelling presentations of insights to teams, senior management and internal & external stakeholders.

We are currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Oil Market Analyst to join our team. The successful candidate will play a critical role in analyzing and forecasting oil market trends and providing valuable insights to support our business decisions. This position requires a minimum of 5 - 8 years of relevant work experience in the oil industry.

Job Description
Become part of the market research team and take a lead role in conducting oil market research and analysis.
Work closely with team members and front desk traders to provide strategic and analytical input to the company.
Construct and maintain databases for key oil statistics, derive key trends, and convert these observations into insightful notes.
Utilize statistical models and data analysis techniques to forecast oil market movements and identify potential risks and opportunities.
Stay updated with industry news, publications, and research reports to maintain a deep understanding of the oil market landscape.
Prepare analytical reports in a timely, relevant, and thought-provoking manner.
Think creatively and lead the team to carry out independent research as well as work on ad-hoc projects.
Any ad-hoc duties assigned by the Superior / Management.
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Economics, Mathematical Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or a related field.
Minimum of 5 - 8 years of experience as an Oil Market Analyst or in a similar role within the oil industry.
Strong knowledge of global oil markets, including supply and demand dynamics, pricing mechanisms, and geopolitical factors.
Proficient in utilizing statistical analysis tools, data visualization software, and Excel for conducting market analysis.
Excellent analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and draw meaningful insights.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, to effectively present analysis findings to various stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
Fluency in English and Chinese is required for composing reports in both languages - English and Chinese.

We offer competitive compensation packages and a stimulating work environment that encourages professional growth and development. If you meet the qualifications and are passionate about the oil market, we encourage you to submit your job application.

Job Title: Business Analyst for Trade Finance (eBanking channels)
Job Description:
Summary:
We are seeking a skilled Business Analyst to join our Trade eBanking Channels team. In this role, you will be responsible for working on projects and providing application support for Trade Finance global releases. Collaborating with Product Managers and Operation users from various APAC regions, you will gather requirements, perform impact analysis, and develop functional specifications for enhancements and production issues. Additionally, as a Business Analyst, you will define the test scope for System Integration Testing (SIT), User Acceptance Testing (UAT), and Non-Regression Testing (NRT), ensuring test outcomes are validated by users and testers.

Responsibilities:
Conduct systematic business analysis to ensure a clear definition of business/operational objectives for new requirements.
Validate business requirements to align with business/operations needs, IT architecture, and security standards.
Design functional solutions, and user workflows, and document Functional Specifications.
Conduct walkthroughs of requirements and proposed solutions with stakeholders, obtaining their review and signoff.
Develop SIT/UAT/NRT scope and approach, guide the Testing team in creating test scenarios/cases, and review them to obtain signoff from stakeholders. Adjust test cases as needed to match available resources and target timelines.
Validate SIT test results produced by the testing team and provide signoff.
Assist users in planning and executing UAT, analyze defects, and prioritize them for fix delivery by the development team.
Document and review user manuals and release notes as required.
Assist in providing tactical/strategic solutions for new client requirements.
Support conversion/migration exercises when necessary.
Perform functional analysis and propose solutions for production defects.
Ensure compliance with Bank policies and adhere to CIB ITO APAC standards/practices.
Participate in technical design reviews and contribute to improving the overall solution offered.

Qualifications & Experience:
3-5 years of experience in a Corporate Banking environment, with specific experience as an IT Business Analyst in Trade Finance (eBanking Channels).
Strong functional and business analysis skills, with the ability to communicate and bridge between business/operations and IT.
Good functional experience in Trade/Electronic invoicing applications.
Excellent team player with a strong commitment and positive attitude.
Effective communication and coordination skills across multicultural and cross-country teams.
Ability to work independently.
Familiarity with standard formats such as SWIFT, EDIFACT, ISO20022, and data transformations.
Proficiency in Unix/Shell scripts, XML, and Oracle/PLSQL.

Squarepoint is a global investment management firm that utilizes a diversified portfolio of systematic and quantitative strategies across financial markets that seeks to achieve high quality, uncorrelated returns for our clients. We have deep expertise in trading, technology and operations and attribute our success to rigorous scientific research. As a technology and data-driven firm, we design and build our own cutting-edge systems, from high performance trading platforms to large scale data analysis and compute farms. With offices around the globe, we emphasize true, global collaboration by aligning our investment, technology and operations teams functionally around the world.

Overview of Quant Researcher Position:
Research and implement strategies within the firm’s automated trading framework.
Analyze large data sets using advanced statistical methods to identify trading opportunities.
Develop a strong understanding of market structure of various exchanges and asset classes.
Typical Day of Quant Researcher:
Primary focus throughout the day is on researching and implementing trading ideas.
Before market open, check that all required data and related processes are ready for the trading day.
During market hours, sporadically monitor behavior and performance of strategies.
Skill Set Required For Position:
Quantitative background - includes degrees in Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Financial Engineering, Operations Research, Computer Science and Physics.
Programming proficiency with at least one major programming or scripting language (e.g. C++, Java, Python).
Strong communication skills and ability to work well with colleagues across multiple regions.
Ability to work well under pressure

Job Summary:
The role of a Business Analyst for an IT product is vital for ensuring that the final product aligns with business objectives and delivers value to users. They help create a bridge between technical teams and business stakeholders, ensuring a smooth and successful development process. The Business Analyst serves as a liaison between various stakeholders including business users and the IT department, translating business needs into functional requirements that guide the development of software solutions and process improvements. You need to gather, document, and analyze business requirements, identify opportunities for process enhancements, and contribute to the successful implementation of technology-driven solutions.
Responsibilities:
General:
Assistance with Manager to lead the workflow between developers, designers and others team member.
Requirement Gathering and Analysis:
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business goals, processes, and needs.
Elicit and document clear and comprehensive business requirements.
Analyze current business processes and systems to identify inefficiencies and areas for improvement.
Translate high-level business objectives into actionable technical specifications.
This involves conducting workshops and research to fully understand the needs and goals of the project.
Ensure data accuracy, completeness, and consistency in all reporting deliverables.
Create automated reports that provide regular updates to relevant teams.
Solution Design:
Develop detailed functional specifications and use cases based on gathered requirements.
Collaborate with development teams to design solutions that align with business needs.
Ensure proposed solutions are feasible and aligned with the organization's technological capabilities.
This includes making decisions about UI/UX, data flow, and integration points.
Process Improvement:
Identify process bottlenecks and areas for optimization.
Recommend process changes, workflow modifications, and automation opportunities to increase efficiency and productivity.
Participate in discussions and workshops to drive continuous improvement initiatives.
Stakeholder Communication:
Act as a bridge between technical and non-technical teams. Clearly communicate requirements and expectations to developers and other team members, and translate technical concepts back to business stakeholders.
Present findings, proposals, and progress updates to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Documentation:
Create and maintain comprehensive documentation of business requirements, functional specifications, and project-related materials.
Create detailed requirement documents, such as user stories, use cases, and functional specifications. These documents outline the features, functionalities, and workflows that the IT product needs to have.
Ensure all documentation is accurate, up-to-date, and easily accessible for reference.
Gap Analysis:
Identify any gaps or inconsistencies in requirements and address them by working with relevant stakeholders. This helps prevent misunderstandings and ensures that everyone is on the same page.
Change Management:
Handle changes to requirements that may arise during the development process. Ensure that changes are properly assessed for impact and communicated to relevant parties.
Testing and Validation:
Assist in defining test cases and scenarios based on the requirements. Work with QA teams to ensure that the product is thoroughly tested and meets the specified criteria.
User Acceptance Testing (UAT):
Coordinate and support UAT with business users to ensure that the product meets their expectations and requirements before it is released.
Project Support:
Assist in project planning, estimation, and prioritization of tasks.
Monitor project progress and communicate potential risks or delays. Work with the team to mitigate these risks and come up with contingency plans.
Provide ongoing support during implementation and post-implementation phases.
Take immediate response action on the issues.
Requirements Prioritization:
Collaborate with stakeholders to prioritize requirements based on business value, technical feasibility, and project constraints. This helps ensure that the most critical features are developed first.
Continuous Improvement:
Gather feedback from stakeholders after product releases and use it to improve future iterations of the product. Identify areas for enhancement and suggest improvements.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and developments in the BI and analytics space.
Identify opportunities for adopting new tools, methodologies, and best practices to enhance BI capabilities.
Transfer of knowledge to other team members to build additional capacity.
Plan the timeline for end-to-end project execution and assist in enforcement of project deadlines and schedules.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field (or equivalent work experience) .
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Proficiency in requirement gathering techniques, documentation, and modeling tools.
Knowledge of business process modeling and improvement methodologies.
Knowledge of Agile methodologies is often beneficial
Ability to create clear and concise documentation
Familiarity with software development life cycle (SDLC) methodologies.
Ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.
Experience in supporting PHP, JS (Vue / Node), Python, Golang, SQL (MySQL/Oracle) in microservices environment
Familiar with cloud infrastructure like, kubernetes, CDN, Databases, S3, in microservices usage environment

Responsibilities:
Conduct compliance audits and assessments to ensure adherence to company policies and regulatory requirements.
Analyze business processes and data to identify compliance risks and develop recommendations for improvement.
Develop and implement compliance monitoring and reporting systems.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement compliance training programs.
Assist in the development and maintenance of compliance policies and procedures.
Stay updated on changes in laws and regulations related to business compliance.
Conduct investigations into compliance violations and assist in developing corrective actions.
Prepare compliance reports and presentations for management.
Provide guidance and support to stakeholders on compliance-related matters.
Assist in the implementation of technology solutions to enhance compliance processes.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, or related field.
Minimum 3 years of experience in business compliance or data analysis roles.
Strong knowledge of compliance regulations and best practices.
Experience in conducting compliance audits and assessments.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills.
Ability to interpret and apply complex regulations and policies.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
Ability to work independently and in a team.

About our group:
Material Science Lab is part of the Research and Development facilities located in Shugart building to support all HDD and some non-HDD material related selection, qualification, failure analysis, etc. The function of the lab includes performing components level material, coating and adhesive selection and pro-active qualification for new products and performing failure analysis on the drives that failed different designed reliability or functional tests, etc. to help in improving the cleanliness/material/coating/adhesive robustness. In addition, perform drives failure analysis to all pre-launch and post launch (e.g., customers’ returns) drives to help in resolving and improving drives quality.
About the role - you will:
Perform proactive components/material outgassing/extraction analysis and support drive failure analysis in terms of organic contamination related area. Investigates, develops, and improvises organic methods and techniques to resolve organic issues.
Develops solutions to technical problems through the application of materials science and engineering principles, theories, and concepts. Investigates and tests drives/components level for organic issues.
Works on problems of diverse scope where analysis of data requires evaluation of identifiable factors. Demonstrates good judgement in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions. Normally receives little instruction on day-to-day work, general instructions on new assignments. This job is a fully qualified, career-oriented, journey-level position.
Run Gas Chromatography/Mass Spectrometer (GC/MS) – Auto Thermal Desorption (ATD) involving daily machine tuning, weekly calibration, worldwide correlation, troubleshooting, and analysis using machine learning macro. Perform drives/components outgassing/chemical extraction and data analysis to provide technical advice in organic contamination related area. Applying AI or relevant automation expertise to streamline the process of automating organic analysis.
About you:
Able to thrive in a fast-paced environment and work with multiple priorities.
Strong team player, collaborative approach and resourceful
Meticulous personality, self-motivated and able to work independently.
Strong analytical skills, able to resolve a wide range of issues in creative ways.
Your experience includes:
Job requires at least a degree (Bachelor or Masters) in Applied Sciences especially Chemistry, Material Science or Engineering field. Preferable with relevant Gas Chromatography/Mass Spectrometer (GC/MS) experience (i.e., operation, troubleshooting & analysis).
Experience in Fourier Transform Infra-Red Spectrometer (FTIR) and Scanning Electron Microscope (SEM) / Energy Dispersive X-ray (EDX) analysis will be an advantage.
Location:
The Shugart site (named after Seagate’s founder, Al Shugart) is a research and design center. Easily accessible from the One-North MRT Station, many employees choose to take mass transportation to work. Being a purpose-built building, The Shugart has excellent employee recreational facilities. Take an active break at our badminton courts, table tennis tables, in-house gym, and recreation rooms. Our yoga and Zumba classes are very popular. We also offer classes and interest groups in photography, gardening, and foreign languages, and have various on-site celebrations, and community volunteer opportunities.

Location: Shugart, Singapore
Travel: None

Overview

Bring your ideas. Make history.
BNY Mellon offers an exciting array of future-forward careers at the intersection of business, finance, and technology. We are one of the world's top asset management and banking firms that manages trillions of dollars in assets, custody and/or administration. Known as the "bank of banks" - 97% of the world's top banks work with us as we lead and serve our customers into the new era of digital.

With over 239 years of rich history and industry firsts, BNY Mellon has been built upon our proven ability to evolve, lead, and drive new ideas at every turn. Today, we're approximately 50,000 employees across 35 countries with a culture that empowers you to grow, take risks, experiment and be yourself. This is what #LifeAtBNYMellon is all about.

We're seeking a future team member for the role of APAC Head of Data & Analytics Business Development to join our GROWTH VENTURES team. This role is located in Singapore (Hybrid).

BNY Mellon's Data and Analytics is a leading software and services business in the financial services industry. We are hiring for an experienced, results-driven Sales Management professional with responsibilities covering the APAC region.

In this role, you'll make an impact in the following ways:
As the Head of Sales in APAC, this role will be responsible for effectively leading, managing and coaching an established and growing sales team responsible for selling cloud based solutions in the region
The position requires a hands on approach to pipeline development and management from lead generation to closing business
Must be an excellent leader, innovative, highly enthusiastic, and motivated to work in a growing, high potential market segment
Successful candidate will engage in continuous, interactive and highly personalised dialogues that drive company revenue and customer satisfaction across the APAC region


To be successful in this role, we're seeking the following:
Proven record of successful meeting and exceeding monthly/quarterly/annual software sales quotas
Ability to identify key decision-makers within prospect companies
Capable of building and maintaining strong customer relationships in region
Past experience in a leadership or sales management role
Experience in the financial industry required, with a strong preference towards ASP/Cloud solutions solution sales
Desire to work in a team environment, wherein time-sensitive and business-savvy decisions must be made in order to best meet client expectations and company goals
Should have good presentation skill
Bachelor's degree or equivalent education or equivalent work experience required
Relevant sales position experience within Financial Services required
Travel across APAC is likely to be required


Qualifications:
Minimum of fifteen (15) years in Sales/Relationship Management, Client Service, or Account Management in Financial Services/Technology/FinTech
Bachelor's degree in business or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required; MBA or other advanced degree preferred
Possess established relationships within/across industry and with clients at c-suite level

At Motorola Solutions, we're guided by a shared purpose - helping people be their best in the moments that matter - and we live up to our purpose every day by solving for safer. Because people can only be their best when they not only feel safe, but are safe. The work we do here matters.

Who Are We?
At HoYoverse, we are committed to creating immersive virtual world experiences for players around the world. In addition to game products such as Genshin Impact, Honkai Impact 3rd, Tears of Themis, and Honkai: Star Rail, HoYoverse also launched the dynamic desktop software N0va Desktop, the community product HoYoLAB, and created a variety of products such as animations, comics, music, novels, and merchandise around our original creative concept.
Adhering to our mission of Tech Otakus Save the World, we have always been committed to technology research and development, exploring cutting-edge technologies, and have accumulated leading technical capabilities in cartoon rendering, artificial intelligence, cloud gaming technology, and other fields.
HoYoverse is actively engaged in globalization, with offices in Singapore, Montreal, Los Angeles, Tokyo, Seoul, and other areas.
When you apply to a position with HoYoverse, we will process your personal data. To learn more about how we process your data, we encourage you to review our comprehensive Global Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy . This policy provides detailed insights into how your information is collected, used, and protected throughout the application process.
What You Will Do:
Build and enhance data analysis system for game project operations, providing daily data support for game-related activities including but not limited to game product analysis, market analysis, and sentiment analysis.
Regularly monitor and analyze game version content, including but not limited to user value, retention, game ecosystem, event version effectiveness, and commercial analysis.
Provide data analysis support for game market distribution, including but not limited to analyzing promotional effects, advertising monitoring, and tracking user behavior.
Provide guidance for game design and product design by analyzing user behavior data and public opinion data through data mining and exploratory analysis.
Responsible for building user behavior data indicators and related platforms, researching refined game operations such as user profile and behavioral analysis etc.
What We Are Looking For:
At least 3 years' related work experience, with at least 2 years in game data analysis and a strong interest in data analysis.
Sensitive to data, familiar with data collection and analysis methods, knowledgeable about data modeling principles and mining algorithms, and understanding of server architecture and database operations.
Experience in the full-cycle of mobile game project data analysis and able to independently carry out research projects.
Possess strong logical and analytical skills, and with excellent teamwork abilities.
We are an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds are key to bringing our concepts to life. If you're looking to play a key role in creating the best immersive virtual world experience for our users, we invite you to join our team.

REV - Revenue Management
Singapore
Cathay Pacific
Application Deadline
01 Apr 2024

Company Description

Let your passion fly! We’re proud to be one of the world’s leading airlines. Our reputation is built on a long track record of success, an ongoing commitment to our home Hong Kong, and on the delivery of customer service that’s straight from the heart. All of this is possible due to our talented people who share our passion for aviation and our commitment to being the best. Our global family can open up a world of opportunities for you. This means that your first role at Cathay Pacific won’t be your last. It could take you anywhere. Join us and discover just how far you can go!
Role Introduction

The Senior Data Insights Analyst is responsible to support the Business Insights &Analytics Manger in the analysis, implementation and performance management of the market or region for optimisation of Corporate, Agency and Digital sales programmes.
In this role, you will support the Business Insights & Analytics team’s end-to-end regional commercial strategy planning process, starting from goal setting, initiatives formulation to implementation and tracking, with the aim to drive revenue across different customer segments and distribution channels. You will use data analytical tools (both internal and external) to perform analysis and provide commercial teams (i.e. Local/Regional Marketing, Digital, Sales teams) with actionable insights that helps to identify revenue opportunities. You will also be responsible for measuring the success of all sales or go-to-market activities, as well as sharing all learnings with respective stakeholders for future improvements.

Key Responsibilities

Business Planning
Work closely with Head Office (Revenue Management, Sales & Distribution, Digital) and Regional Teams on end-to-end business planning process, from developing strategic commercial strategy, campaigns/initiatives planning to execution and performance tracking
Consolidate local market intelligence or any sales opportunities (e.g. MICE, special group movements) and share/discuss with Head Office with proposed plan to win deals with high success rates and incremental revenue
Develop targeted and customer-centric incentives action plans that are competitive in the local markets within assigned budget
Support local sales teams in tracking incentives performance, business development or up-/cross-selling activities so that CX remains as the preferred choice for the trade partners and for our customers
Observe market activities and brainstorm with local stakeholders to design customized products for targeted customer segments, and collaborate with Head Office for new product launch
Assist Regional Head of Business Insights & Analytics to formulate commercial budget plan
Be actively involved in formulating and ensuring the achievement of the offline market distribution strategy for the region (if applicable)
Devise strategy to improve value of incentives and NDC remunerations in the region

Analytics Champion
Act as the analytics champion for the region – i.e. well-versed with all in-house and external data analytical tools (i.e. DDS, QlikSense, PRISM)
Analyze data, develop reports, draw inferences and provide actionable insights to Regional Sales Teams, including new trends/customer purchase behaviors, new sales opportunities and areas of improvements
Own the performance tracking of all campaigns/ initiatives with clear and defined metrics; identify learning points and continue to improve so as to achieve the target
Drive adoption of all analytical tools and cultivate data-driven culture within the Regional and Outport teams
Conduct ad-hoc commercial studies and support Head Office-driven analytics projects when required

Pricing and Fare Filing
Provide local-specific insights in the formulation of pricing strategies with HO RMO
Monitor the effectiveness of the pricing strategies and initiate change discussions when needed
Responsible for year-round proactive campaign planning process – i.e. developing campaign proposals, benchmarking, market insights and campaign tracking
Review and analyze local market Corporate discount parameters, Global Specialty products (i.e. students/MICE/Seamen/Cruise)
Manage communications with local sales teams on fare changes, fare conditions revision, new products/campaigns launches and/or any government fares filing (if required)
Provide Corporates fare filing support (i.e. new or updated changes) for local Corporate sales teams
Assist with checking new live fares on GDS to ensure 100% accuracy and troubleshooting of any fare auto-pricing errors
Manage ad-hoc fare proposal and requests

E&A Responsibility
Emergency and Accident and Crisis Response responsibilities as required
Requirements

Qualifications and Requirements
University Degree (Preferably in related disciplines) with minimum 3+ years’ experience in data analysis in a regional team set up
Strong numeric and statistical analytical skills are essential
Able to present analysis clearly with findings and actionable insights
Demonstrated positive and innovative learning attitude, problem-solving skills and stakeholder management
Knowledge of airline/travel management systems including DDS, MIDT and PRISM is an advantage
Practical experience with any analytical tools (i.e. QlikSense, Tableau, QlikView) is an advantage
Travel/Airline industry experience preferred
Expert knowledge of MS Suite of tools
Benefits

Be part of the Cathay Pacific family and join a dynamic team culture working for one of the world’s Top 10 Global Airlines.
Make the most of your leave and take advantage of travel industry discounts including airfares, hotels, tours and car hire.
Fly high with career development opportunities to diversify your skills and experience within the Cathay Pacific family.

Do you want your voice heard and your actions to count?
Discover your opportunity with Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), the 7th largest financial group in the world. Across the globe, we’re 160,000 colleagues, striving to make a difference for every client, organization, and community we serve. We stand for our values, building long-term relationships, serving society, and fostering shared and sustainable growth for a better world.
With a vision to be the world’s most trusted financial group, it’s part of our culture to put people first, listen to new and diverse ideas and collaborate toward greater innovation, speed and agility. This means investing in talent, technologies, and tools that empower you to own your career.
Join MUFG, where being inspired is expected and making a meaningful impact is rewarded.
Purpose of the Role:
You will be a part of the Asian Investment Banking Division (“AIBD”) that sits in the front line, responsible for the promotion of Corporate & Investment Banking (“CIB”) products and services in the Asia and Oceania region, covering both Global Corporates and Japanese Corporates. The Portfolio Management department is a key function in AIBD that takes over the management of structured loans originated in AIBD, including real estate, oil and gas, infrastructure, renewables, energy and utilities, to monitor and enhance the credit quality of the portfolio through direct engagement of external and internal stakeholders and through credit risk assessment and support.
Your role will entail managing a portfolio of structured finance assets across Asia originated in Project Finance (power, natural resources, and infrastructure) and Shipping Finance. A key objective of the role is to provide strategic insight to the portfolio as first line of defense.
Job Responsibilities:
You will play an important role in our team by taking on responsibilities that include (but are not limited to):
Client Management and Strategy
Active management of the overall risk profile of assets throughout project life, including ongoing monitoring of client and project conditions, proactive risk identification, recommendation of risk mitigants, and Management reporting.
Implementation of solutions through stakeholder negotiations with clients, bank syndicates, external specialist advisors and internal stakeholders including negotiation of waiver terms and amendment documents.
Co-work with Origination team in the arrangement of refinancing transaction, such as deal execution, negotiation, documentation review.
Support the execution of work-out transactions, including restructuring terms, negotiation, preparing financial models, negotiate documentation.
Maintenance of good client relationships through regular direct contact with clients to represent the business objectives to resolve issues while managing customer needs.
Portfolio Management, Credit Risk Analysis and Reporting
Work on portfolio strategies, including the performance of stress testing, sector analysis and other portfolio analysis
Assessment and execution of secondary loan sales in collaboration with the MUFG Distribution Team
Preparation and oversight of borrower rating, credit applications and reviews
Preparation and oversight of Management, Head Office and Regulatory Reporting
Preparation and coordination of internal and external audits, and inspections
Strategic Initiatives
Implementation of strategic initiatives, including enhancements to the credit monitoring process to improve business efficiency.
Supporting the Head of Department in overall management of the portfolio and sector coverage.
Job Requirements
Degree qualified
Degree in Finance, Banking, Accounting, Economics or related discipline
Candidates with experience should possess good understanding of banking products, credit risk, financial analysis, critical and data analysis, impact sensitivity studies, cashflow or financial modelling, options analysis, reviews of credit control, financing documentation and legal considerations.
Experience in structured product financing would be beneficial. Good technical skills (including Excel proficiency), a strategic mindset and business acumen.
Good organisation skills and attention to details and accuracy.
Good communication, presentation and writing skills.
Proactive, resourceful and a good team player, with ability to build rapport with internal and external parties.

Internship in banking or a minimum of 1 year experience in credit analysis, credit writing experience in similar structured finance or corporate banking

Minimum 5 years of experience in credit analysis, credit writing, recommendation to credit committee

There is a place for you at T. Rowe Price to grow, contribute, learn, and make a difference. We are a premier asset manager focused on delivering global investment management excellence and retirement services that investors can rely on today and in the future. The work we do matters. We invite you to explore the opportunity to join us and grow your career with us.
POSITION PURPOSE
Come join a high-impact team that is focused on building out capabilities for our APAC investor websites to help drive business growth and market leading client experiences. As a Product Analyst, this person will be responsible for collecting data and conducting analysis in support of a digital product team focused on delivering experiences that drive our strategic business goals. They will gather and organize product/services data, user stories, and features to support prioritization of the product backlog, and analyze collected information to inform the development of enablement tools/tactics.
This is a unique opportunity to bridge business needs and technical solutions to help T. Rowe Price progress in digital capability maturity for our APAC markets.
Principal Responsibilities
Solutions Delivery—Supports refinement activities within a product team, specifically defining and writing user stories, acceptance criteria, and user interface design for platform and product enhancements; activities to include obtaining acceptance and alignment from stakeholders for the recommended enhancements, documenting requirements along with prioritization, user acceptance testing, and working with technology teams to deliver enhancements that generate business value.
Assessing Client Experience—Analyzes user behavior and feedback to validate that products work as desired relative to key performance indicators. Regularly reviews quantitative and qualitative performance indicators, including operational metrics, client surveys, direct client feedback, and associate feedback, escalating issues to product owners as necessary. Leverages understanding of competitive landscape to identify and propose changes to enhance experience.
Business Analytics — Provides consultative support to product owners and other stakeholders as it relates to existing and potentially new deliverables to enhance client experiences. Shares findings and provides business insight to product owners as needed. Works closely with platform analysts to interpret data and uses insight to inform necessary changes.
PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES / SKILLS / QUALIFICATIONS
Required
Bachelor's degree or the equivalent combination of education and relevant experience
2+ years of total relevant work experience
Experience in Agile Development methodologies
Preferred
Experience in the investment management/financial services industry
Strong technical skills in using Adobe Experience Manager Content Management Systems (CMS), or in other CMS

The Product Management team at Shopee is the key focal point between the business, engineering and design teams. About the Team:
Shopee Marketplace Product Team sits at the core of our e-commerce platform, where we serve millions of buyers and sellers who interact with us daily. Our team builds and maintains the core services and capabilities to support the large volume of transactions happening around the clock. We work closely with business and operations teams in different markets to ensure the platform's optimal performance and efficiency. Our team's commitment and adaptability are fundamental to the continuous improvement and success of Shopee’s e-commerce ecosystem.
Job Description:

Senior Pricing Analyst
Our culture believes in POWERING YOUR POTENTIAL . We provide global opportunities to develop your career, make your community a better place and work with today’s most innovative thinkers to solve the world’s toughest problems.
We believe in flexibility for you to explore your passions while making an impact through meaningful work within our inclusive workforce. That’s what #LifeAtCummins is all about.
We are looking for a talented Senior Pricing Analyst to join our team in Tuas South, Singapore . This role will be following Hybrid work model . Multiple location option is available (Singapore or Australia)
In this role, you will make an impact in the following ways:
Produces and secures the distribution of pricing information (electronic media and catalogs) and maintains a library of analytical programs. Implements pricing changes throughout the company and the customer base.
Maintains accurate pricing data in order management and rebates systems including account setup and data verification; tracks and monitors win/loss data such as requests for quotes.
Makes pricing recommendations on new product pricing and price changes; implements and reviews price adjustments; executes pricing strategy at a new product or market segment level.
Leads, manages, or participates in pricing improvement projects; develops outcome and pricing improvements.
Creates reports and analysis; presents results and conclusions to managers.
Provides direct and prompt assistance to customers regarding complex pricing issues through various media (phone, email, fax, letter).
Maintains confidential information and manages the use of this information appropriately.
Contributes to continuous improvement teams and implements new processes and programs.
Coaches and mentors less experienced Pricing Analysts.
Qualifications
To be successful in this role you will need the following:
Customer focus - Building strong customer relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions.
Ensures accountability - Holding self and others accountable to meet commitments.
Builds networks - Effectively building formal and informal relationship networks inside and outside the organization.
Collaborates - Building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives.
Communicates effectively - Developing and delivering multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences.
Manages ambiguity - Operating effectively, even when things are not certain, or the way forward is not clear.
Translating Relevant Market Data - Collects and categorizes customer voices and market information by leveraging appropriate research tools and techniques; analyses research findings to identify opportunities to deliver customer solutions.
Market Forecasting - Analyses and interprets market data from a variety of internal and external sources and modelling to formulate unbiased market projections specific to business segment.
Pricing Strategy - Develops prices by aligning and building consensus with key stakeholders across functions to achieve business targets.
Preferred Qualification:
College, university, or equivalent degree in Finance, Marketing, Strategy, Accounting, or a related subject required. This position may require licensing for compliance with export controls or sanctions regulations.
Intermediate level of relevant work experience required.
Intermediate in Excel and BI tools and good to have SAP knowledge.
Analytical background preferred.
Attention to details, good communication, collaborative and problem solver.
This role is not able to support on cross-border relocation, but this role can also be filled in AU (Sydney or Melbourne) based on candidate’s location.
Compensation and Benefits
Permanent Salary, AWS, Flexi Benefits, Annual remuneration reviews and a range of personal and professional benefits. Participation in an annual variable compensation (bonus) program

Job Title: AVP, Risk Analyst for Debt Capital Markets (DCM) Business
Job Description:
Do you want your voice heard and your actions to count?
Discover your opportunity with Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), the 6th largest financial group in the world. Across the globe, we’re 160,000 colleagues, striving to make a difference for every client, organization, and community we serve. We stand for our values, building long-term relationships, serving society, and fostering shared and sustainable growth for a better world.
With a vision to be the world’s most trusted financial group, it’s part of our culture to put people first, listen to new and diverse ideas and collaborate toward greater innovation, speed and agility. This means investing in talent, technologies, and tools that empower you to own your career.
Join MUFG, where being inspired is expected and making a meaningful impact is rewarded.
Job responsibilities:
The AVP role within the market risk management department will be in charge of
Providing risk assessment to underwriting transactions by Asia Investment Banking Debt Capital Market (DCM) business. Review and challenge of DCM’s new and on-going transactions. Generation of reports to track and monitor the underwriting (UW) positions.
[Risk Assessment for DCM business (Marketable Credit Risk) – 90%]
Analyse and evaluate Debt Capital Markets team’s underwriting applications. This includes reviewing transaction material and the analysis submitted by the Business, checking the compliance of UW transactions with policy and underwriting guidelines
Preparing risk assessment commentaries on various risk categories such as Transaction Structure, Pricing and Liquidity Map in a quick and prompt turnaround manner
Coordinate and Participate in Underwriting Committee
Liaison point for various stakeholders – DCM team, International Credit Division (ICD), Head office Risk team, Internal Audit and senior management
Review and Challenge front line to enhance the overall risk framework from the second line of defence perspective
Prepare daily and periodic reports of Underwriting business transactions
Monitor and review the various thresholds and limits set for Notional, Underwriting Period, Loss limits for Underwriting business
Track and monitor the Early Warning Indicator (EWI) for Underwriting business
Organize regular/Ad-hoc meetings with other stakeholders in the bank to get updates on new developments on the pipeline transactions and any other underwriting related matters from Tokyo Head office and Europe/America regions
Support the team in maintaining and reviewing the documentation (e.g., Policy and Procedure) related to UW business from risk perspective
Support the line leader/team leader in market risk department as required
[Market risk– 10%]
Support Market risk department with Macro Market analysis, Control checks, Risk and PnL Monitoring, Risk analysis, Market data capture and support to other branches in the region
Job Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics or related fields
At least 3 years working experience in Market risk, Credit Risk or Investment Banking
Broad product knowledge and competence in the analysis and documentation of loan, bond, trade finance, structured transactions and traded products, including derivatives and securities financing transactions
Sound knowledge and experience in risk analysis and formulating recommendations/comments on credit proposals
CFA, CPA or FRM certification is desirable but not must
Good knowledge of Excel, Word and Powerpoint
Good initiative and inter-personal skills, ability to work efficiently in a team and independently.
Good communication skills (both verbal & writing)

We regret to inform that only shortlisted applicants will be notified.

We are seeking a talented and detail-oriented Supply Chain Business Process Analyst to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for creating, implementing, and maintaining supply chain business processes, working closely with business partners to identify and prioritize process improvement opportunities. They will develop prototype user solutions to support those processes, obtain business sign-off on end-to-end process proposals, and collaborate with IT to define the technical solutions required.
Responsibilities:
Analyze supply chain processes to identify opportunities for improvement.
Assist senior management with business case development and project funding.
Prototype Solutions to simulate process improvement.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and document project planning and key project milestone deliverables.
Define testing and success criteria for the new process.
Manage end user training activities and other management of change activities.
Develop, implement, and track relevant metrics and KPIs as defined in the business case
Develop and maintain documentation on supply chain processes and procedures.
Assist in the design and implementation of supply chain systems and tools.
Conduct training sessions for supply chain team members on new processes and tools.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in business, supply chain, or related field
2-5 years of experience in supply chain or operations
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Proficiency in data analysis tools
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to work independently and collaboratively with cross-functional teams
Knowledge of supply chain management systems and tools
Demonstrated examples of Project management skills
Industry 4.0 competency with respect to implementation of standards across the enterprise
If you are a results-driven Supply Chain Business Process Analyst with a passion for driving process improvements and optimizing supply chain performance, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

This specific role is opened on behalf of Woh Hup Pte Ltd, the parent company to Core Collective Pte Ltd.
Reporting to the Finance Manager, the Senior Finance Ops Analyst will play a key role in the Finance team to deliver the full spectrum of professional accounting and finance activities to Woh Hup (WH) Group of companies. This position offers the opportunity to gain a deep expertise within the finance function with the ability to work with senior stakeholders, and to lead and drive business optimization projects from the planning through to implementation.
Given the dynamic nature of the business, the below is a non-exhaustive list of deliveries expected from the candidate. However, it covers the foundation responsibilities and capabilities that are required for the candidate to be successful in this role.
Financial accounting and reporting: Preparation of audited financial statements in compliance to professional accounting standards and external auditor requirements, supporting business new ventures through providing finance and accounting advice, and supporting initiatives to adopt new accounting standards.
Transactional accounting and closing processes: Perform month-end close activities including accurately recording and reviewing financial transactions, overseeing critical accounts payable and receivable processes, preparing submissions to external auditors, IRAS and other parties, and identifying ways to mitigate risks and continuously improve. Ensure a strong risk and control environment throughout.
Cost accounting and reporting: Analyze the main drivers of performance and confidently explain to senior stakeholders the reasons for variances. Confidence in driving improved cost control and insights with business stakeholders.
Planning and Appraisal: Input to the business planning, budgeting and forecast processes, and produce management information reports to help drive decision making by senior stakeholders. Proactively highlight business value drivers and risks with business leads.
Change management and growth opportunities: Support and shadow the Finance Manager as the finance lead for transformation and growth projects, e.g. but not limited to new market/business expansions, driving operational excellence in finance operations, project managing the implementation of new systems and digital transformation.
Adherence to safety in the workplace
The ideal candidate should have:
A degree in Finance / Accountancy / Banking or its equivalent.
Minimum 4 years of relevant experience and expertise across the spectrum of Finance competences with solid foundation in financial accounting, operational accounting and reporting, and working knowledge of IT systems implementations. Finance professional qualification and SAP knowledge preferred. Exposure to Treasury and Tax will be useful.
Confident in managing large and complex data sets in Excel and in a wider digital environment. Able to assess data, extract insights from financial and accounting software and navigate between different types of digital tools to produce results. Continuously learning new and better ways to manage and analyze data to support business outcomes.
They are an effective communicator with ability to gain the confidence of various internal and external parties building on strong knowledge and understanding of the business drivers, value and risk. They also possess an eye for detail and are results oriented, willing to challenge the status quo and strive for continuous improvement.
MNC experience will be valuable from the perspective of systems and processes and of reporting and accounting in compliance with local and international standards. Experience in the construction / asset-heavy industries would also be valued.
The individual has strong project management skills and has experience contributing towards formalizing processes and systems and in enhancing the performance of the finance function - and at the same time proven flexibility with ability to create, develop and adapt in the face of a dynamic situation.
Strong growth mindset and high personal integrity. A team player, with a positive proactive approach to managing and solving problems. Ability to collaborate across different teams is key.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $4,200.00 - $6,000.00 per month
Benefits:
Cell phone reimbursement
Dental insurance
Flexible schedule
Work from home
Supplemental pay types:
Performance bonus
Work Location: Hybrid remote in Singapore 588185

Job Function: Software & Cloud Services The role:
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Solution Architect – Data Analytics for Azure to join our team and play a crucial role in designing and implementing data analytics solutions on the Microsoft Azure platform. Security and Compliance: Implement security measures and best practices to protect sensitive data and ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations.
Troubleshooting and Optimization: Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks, data quality issues, and other challenges that may arise during implementation and operation.
Collaboration: Work closely with data engineers, data scientists, business analysts, and stakeholders to understand their needs and provide technical guidance.
Innovation: Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies to recommend innovative solutions that enhance our data analytics capabilities
What we need to see from you:
Proven experience (3+ years) as a Solution Architect/Pre-sales or similar role, with a focus on data analytics and AZURE cloud technologies, and experience and knowledge on AWS Analytics technology is a plus.
Extensive hands-on experience with AZURE services such as Azure Synapse, Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Microsoft PowerBI, etc.
Strong understanding of data modeling, ETL processes, data warehousing, and data governance principles.
Familiarity with programming/scripting languages like Python, SQL, and experience with data manipulation and transformation.
Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to design and implement creative solutions for complex data challenges.
Strong communication skills to effectively collaborate with technical and non-technical teams.
AZURE certifications (e.g., Microsoft Certified: Power Platform Solution Architect Expert or Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect Expert) are a plus.
Experience in working with Agile methodologies and version control systems.
Proven ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities effectively.

Bachelors or associate degree in IT discipline
Certification in Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Fundamentals is a must.What we need to see from you
Report to practice lead.
Work closely with sales team to develop opportunities and solution proposal
Work within project team to develop and test data analytics platform and model
Design, develop, and unit test in accordance with established standards.

Package and support deployment releases.

Job Title: Senior Consultant (Data, Analytics & Digital) | Strategic Communications | Singapore
Job Description:
About the Role

Our Strategic Communications group is seeking an entrepreneurial and creative candidate to join the Singapore Team. The successful candidate will work in close collaboration with digital and data regional team members, both in strategic communications and cross segment with FTI’s stand-alone data practice, to service our client’s needs and continue to develop our capabilities and service offering across South East Asia.

Data and analytics: The successful candidate will use data to provide knowledge and intelligence to our consultants and clients on everything from corporate reputation performance and industry trends, to government insights and policy and regulation changes, using our tools to access intel and their analytical capabilities to translate the data into actionable insights.

Digital: The chosen candidate will support in the creation and management of digital communications campaigns including but not limited to C-suite and corporate Linked In strategy and management, corporate content and distribution, crisis and issues audits, preparedness and management and social listening analysis and subsequent counsel.


What You'll Do
Act as a data, analytics and digital ambassador!
Lead data, analytics and digital projects for clients from deep dive analysis and reporting to programme design and implementation
Support the team with data and digital strategy
Proactively and accurately identify and frame client challenges and propose data-driven solutions
Champion the vision and strategy of the data and analytics offering internally and externally
Support the growth of the data, analytics and digital offering in Singapore and the APAC region
Deliver actionable insights for projects in the areas of audience & influencer insights, conversation & media analysis, campaign & message performance, event assessment and more
Detect hidden patterns, identify trends, reveal drivers, predict developments, visualize similarities and differences, and otherwise leverage data to deliver actionable insights
Support new business efforts by delivering data-driven insights to inform our approach
Support the development of thought leadership surrounding emerging trends and issues
Work closely with a diverse, global team of data experts on clients across the world

Why FTI?
We are uniquely placed to offer not just strategic communications advice, but full business consultancy, which means when we say we are Experts with Impact, we really mean it! From a dedicated AI team to Economists, ex-politicians and government advisers plus true industry experts who have worked on a range matters over decades, FTI is a place you will learn, grow and evolve. We center ourselves on Maximizing the Impact of Leaders who Shape a Better Future. Working with corporates and C-suites to help them progress and continuously develop, and seeing the results, is what drives us.

We help our people to be experts in their field by giving the right training and opportunities. We promote cross market collaboration and our rising stars have the opportunity to travel to offices around the world to experience global learning and leadership.

Our Ideal Candidate:
Behaviours
Strong intellectual curiosity and exceptional critical thinking
Passion for tackling challenging problems and skilled in handling ambiguity and uncertainty
Relationship builder
Motivator
Goal-orientated
Team driven
Qualifications / experience
At least 5 years and above of experience in a data and digital environment
Expertise with data visualization tools (preferably Tableau, Gephi)
Expertise in journalism, media, communications, or marketing
Proven expertise in turning information into actionable insights
Proven expertise in digital Communicators campaigns
Ability to translate abstract and technical concepts into simple language and relatable ideas
Experience with media and conversation analysis
Proficiency with digital listening tools (e.g. Brandwatch/Talkwalker)
#LI-PN1
Our Benefits

Apart from the well-structured career path and collaborative team environment, our employees enjoy a variety of perks and benefits. Our benefits include, but are not limited to:
Competitive remuneration package
Comprehensive leave policy
Health care benefits including dependents
Education subsidy with study and examination leaves
Annual paid volunteer hours

About FTI Consulting

What makes us unique? With more than 8,000+ employees located in offices in every corner of the globe, we are the firm our clients call when their most important issues are at stake. Regardless of what level you are, you will have the opportunity to work alongside and learn from top experts in your field on high-profile engagements that impact history. Job Description
This role sits withing the FM Trade data services team which involves extending the Customers Trade Lake which is a core component of the platform, to build a future-proof trade store solution meeting on-going regulatory projects requirements, as well as enabling the strategic aim of reducing point to point connections and reliance on fragmented legacy systems, and supporting advanced Analytics on FM Trade data.

In-flight work on the platform includes:
Extension of the current data model (FpML) to support new use cases
Extension of the Trade Lake API supporting high performance querying on a Business data dictionary of trade attributes, enabling quick turnaround of business benefits through self-service data extraction capability
Support for direct Trade Booking and Life-Cycling within the SABRE Application
Formulate and transition the Trade Lake control framework into BAU
On-going remediation of data accuracy and data completeness gaps
Supporting other project / reporting demands (MiFID2, SFTR, SEC, MAR, Securities Settlements, etc…)
JOB PURPOSE
Building strong, effective relationships with both the business and technology teams, across global offices.
Collaborating with trade platform teams, project teams and control functions to gather requirements, solve business problems by proposing relevant, innovative solutions
Working across Trade Processing platforms (ECommerce, SABRE, Murex 3.1, Murex 2.11, BTS (Bloomberg Trading System), Apex, Wealth Management platforms)
Working as part of an agile team including Business Analysts, Developers and Testers and being able to identify business implications of technical design decisions and influence them accordingly.
Being a creative source of proposals and channelling user aspiration towards sustainable and future proof solutions
Deliver functional consistency across the various projects by influencing architecture and design decisions
Translating and documenting business requirements
Working across asset classes of FX, ALM, Rates, Credits and Commodities
Understand user requirements and study the feasibility. Propose solutions that align to the strategic roadmap. Cleary document and agree on assumptions, shortfalls and timelines to resolve the known constraints and dependencies.
Pro-actively highlight risk and issues. Engage, manage and build strong relationships with both business and technology stakeholders
Translate solutions into detailed, unambiguous, business and functional requirements
Ensure the overall quality of business requirements, functional specifications and other supporting documents meet the bank’s standards
Work proactively with fellow BAs and other team members, ensuring work is proportionally distributed and targets are met
Ensure documents such as functional specs support the development of practical technology solutions and suitable test cases
Work as part of a combined cross-functional agile team and support the on-going build as required e.g. drafting/reviewing of test cases, closing out developers open issues/questions, contributing to solution design etc…
Assist the business with UAT, including communication, planning, preparation and test case preparation
Identify risks and issues early, plan mitigating steps and communicate these to PMs and business stakeholders in a timely manner

JOB SUMMARY
Financial Markets Business Analyst, focusing on the Market Risk Stress Testing platform upkeep, enhancements, and Upgrades
The role sits in the Customer’s Financial Markets Trade Management team focusing on the build out of the in-house strategic cross asset risk platform is the bank’s strategic platform for trade processing, valuation and market. It consists in designing and delivering solutions to the users of this platform with an initial focus onboarding new products, driving enhancement solutions, planning project timelines and working with multiple stakeholders such as users and developers to achieve desired outcome.
As the main focus of the role is on the Trade Data Store, experience in trade booking, lifecycling and how a trade prices using static or market data is preferable. This would also require basic understanding of the financial products booked in the trades, such as FX, IR Swaps, Loans/Deposits, etc
The candidate should also have experience in MUREX trade booking, lifecycle events and cash settlement logic and processing. He/She would need to be able to explain the trade economics of the financial products, explain the Present Value of the trade and cashflow. He/She will also need to participate in trade migration verification activities, where the ability to design a solution for reconciliation of trade details and settled cash would be needed.

Support User queries and production issues. Manage Platform analytics upgrade for Stress Testing.

When you’re part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work, like helping customers in finding cures for cancer, protecting the environment or making sure our food is safe. Your work will have a real-world impact, and you’ll be supported in achieving your career goals.
Location: Marsiling Industrial Estate Road 3 (5 mins walk from Woodlands MRT / bus interchange)
How will you make an impact?
As part of Thermo Fisher Scientific, you will work on a team that develops and tests software to support the instrument touchscreen software and analysis software for qPCR and dPCR instruments. As a test engineer, You will create and execute test cases to ensure completeness and quality. You will collaborate with the team to develop product features to ensure we build the right product for our customers.
What you will do!
Collaborate with the team to prepare software documents, set up test environments and test management systems
Work with the team to perform requirement analysis, develop test cases and execute test cases
Work with the team to update test results and log defects to the test management system
Writing automation scripts to automate the test case and perform automation test
Work in a geographically separated team in different time zones
How will you get here?
Technical degree with 2-3 years of meaningful experience as a software professional
Experience
Overall 2-3 years experience in the following:
Experience in software quality, writing test plans, test cases and test protocols.
Ability to identify, reproduce and describe software defects
Familiar with Agile/Scrum development environment
Completed 2-3 full cycle SW testing projects
A year of experience using test automation tools
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities
Experience with SQL and HP ALM test management system is preferred
Experience with automated testing tools is preferred
Familiarity with one or more performance and load testing is preferred
Familiarity with API testing and IVD Software testing is preferred
Proficient written and verbal communication in the English language
Interest in science and ability to learn basic scientific principles
Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Watch as our colleagues explain 5 reasons to work with us. As one team of 100,000+ colleagues, we share a common set of values - Integrity, Intensity, Innovation and Involvement - working together to accelerate research, solve complex scientific challenges, drive technological innovation and support patients in need. #StartYourStory at Thermo Fisher Scientific, where diverse experiences, backgrounds and perspectives are valued.
Apply today! http://jobs.thermofisher.com

Responsibilities

As a Cloud Engineer at QCP, you will be responsible for the design, implementation, and maintenance of our AWS infrastructure. This position be within the Technology Operations team reporting to the Head of Technology. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure the availability, scalability, and security of our cloud-based systems. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience with AWS services, a strong understanding of cloud architecture best practices, and a passion for staying up-to-date with the latest cloud technologies.

AWS Infrastructure Management
Design, deploy, and maintain scalable and highly available AWS infrastructure.
Implement and manage AWS services such as ECS, EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, Networking, and others as needed.
Design and test workload architectures to withstand failures and meet availability goals
Monitor and optimize resource utilization, performance, reliability, and costs.

Security and Compliance
Implement and enforce security best practices in the AWS environment (e.g. Service Control Policies, Landing Zone, Control Tower, etc.).
Conduct regular security assessments and audits to ensure compliance with industry and regulatory standards.
Collaborate with the security team to respond to and remediate security incidents.
Enhance cloud infrastructure and data protection in accordance with Well Architected Framework principles.

Automation
Develop and maintain infrastructure as code (IaC) using tools such as Terraform or CloudFormation.
The construct of company approved architectural design patterns for new cloud services that can be shared across projects and teams.
Implement automation scripts to streamline routine tasks and enhance operational efficiency.

Monitoring and Alerting
Set up and configure monitoring and alerting systems to ensure proactive identification and resolution of issues.
Respond to and resolve incidents, working with other teams as necessary.

Collaboration
Collaborate with development and production teams to ensure seamless integration of cloud services.
Provide technical guidance and support to team members and stakeholders.

Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
Proven experience as a Cloud Engineer with a focus on AWS.
AWS certifications an advantage. (e.g., AWS Certified Solutions Architect, AWS Certified DevOps Engineer)
Strong knowledge of cloud architecture best practices, security, and compliance.
Experience with infrastructure as code tools (Terraform, CloudFormation, CDK).
Proficiency in scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash).
Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps and/or DevSecOps practices.
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.

The Environment We Offer

As a growing firm with a tightly-knit team, we respect and listen to all our employees. You will get the chance to make an impact by having your voice heard by everyone, including the management.

Our employees enjoy a high level of autonomy at work. We focus on substance, not form - as long as you can perform, you will be recognized and rewarded. We are also dedicated to supporting our staff and ensuring they develop holistically to maximize their potential in the long- term.

We also provide flexible working arrangement as required and a casual and fun environment to boot!

Web Developer Intern Roles and Responsibilities:
Improve & automate company's business process through creation of new PHP web applications & improvement of existing code.
Review of company's existing process systems to improve UI/UX for both internal and external users.
Be involved in improvement of company's iOS & Android application
Connecting SQL Databases to developed web applications
Review and improve company's current cronjobs and APIs for both internal and external software.
Ensure that new projects are moved from development phase to production phase smoothly, and are both desktop & mobile friendly.
Spearhead development of new landing pages for company's website on WordPress platform, with usage of HTML & CSS code involved.
Modify and improve current landing pages for company's website, with the addition of new functionalities.
Data mining of websites and database for information to be used in company's IT projects.
Learning Outcomes & Objectives:
Intern will be exposed to the movement of IT projects from development phase to production phase in a systematic & meticulous manner.
Intern will have the first-hand experience of building code which can be translated into real-world business usage, to solve actual business problems.
Intern will learn how to manage expectations of different stakeholders, in particular balancing between "design wants" of the company and limitations of existing web platforms.
Intern will gain valuable first-hand experience of developing mobile applications, as well as creating new website landing pages from scratch in a professional setting.
Intern will gain insights on mining data content and using it for real-life application purposes.
Intern will be able to review and suggest opinions on how certain UI/UX interfaces of the company can be improved, and carry out plans for improvement.
Intern will also be able to review codes and script written by previous developers; learning from examples and improvement on existing code.
Intern will also have access to a "senior developer" who will be able to answer queries & troubleshoot whever necessary
Requirements:
Has to be a current University Undergraduate in a computing-related course
Possess some previous experience with website designing / programming
Proficient with PHP, Javascript, HTML, CSS, Languages
A good team player who is able to communicate effectively with various internal and external stakeholders
Ability to think critically and be able to suggest possible improvements to existing company software systems
Possess adequate problem-solving skills to tackle day-to-day issues independently

We are looking for a highly skilled Data Engineer/Developer to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining data pipelines, ETL processes, and data models. They should have a strong background in database management, data warehousing, and programming languages such as SQL, Python, or Java. Responsibilities:
Design, develop, and implement data processing pipelines to process large volumes of structured and unstructured data

Should have good knowledge and working experience in scripting using (Shell script, awk programming, quick automation to integrating any third party tools), BMC monitoring tools
Good understanding and knowledge in Data Modelling area using industry standard data model like (FSLDM)
Collaborate with data engineers, data scientists, and other stakeholders to understand requirements and translate them into technical specifications and solutions

Implement data transformations, aggregations, and computations using Spark RDDs, DataFrames, and Datasets, and integrate them with Elasticsearch
Develop and maintain scalable and fault-tolerant Spark applications, adhering to industry best practices and coding standards
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to data processing, performance, and data quality in the Spark-Elasticsearch integration
Monitor and analyze job performance metrics, identify bottlenecks, and propose optimizations in both Spark and Elasticsearch components
Prior experience in developing banking application using ETL, Hadoop is mandatory. In depth knowledge of technology stack at global banks is mandatory.

7+ years of AS400, RPG, CLP & SQL
Knowledge of Aldon Change Management System(ACMS) is a must·
Experience in developing Hadoop
Experience in data lake (integration of different data sources into the data lake)
SQL Stored Procedures/Queries/Functions
Unix Scripting
Experience with distributed computing, parallel processing, and working with large datasets
Familiarity with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Hive, and HDFS
Job Scheduling in Control-M
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills with the ability to debug and resolve complex issues
Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) and collaborative development workflows
